campaign.story:
Emma Loves Weight-Less Sitting!
     Zero Gravity Upright Posture (ZGUP) Cushion is undoubtedly the most ergonomic and comfortable cushion you will find. it produces a weightless sitting experience so you can get up feeling revitalized.  Releases sitting stress & slumping stress on your spine and hips, and promotes a healthier lifestyle, and Reduce neck, shoulder, and back pain to power through your day.
   Improving posture could be a vague idea. You may think a series of personal training sessions, strict diets, and miles of walking and running will do the trick. 
However, it is actually easier than that. Muscles are very dynamic. Re-training the muscles can changes your bone structure. Here is a catch though. Building muscles memory takes about 3 months. Plus, you need to introduce new good habits to your muscles. It's like learning how to play golf for the first time. 
Using the Zero-Gravity Upright Posture Cushion helps build muscle memory. Your body will realize poor posture and bad habits, and start working towards good posture. Using it for months will make your body feel a ton much better. Consistency. That's why we build this cushion because it can fit into your lifestyle seamlessly and change your habits immediately.
      Slumping Stress indicates:
1. Inflexibility of the Joints indicates Stiffness in Hips, Knees, Back & Neck (Spines)
2. Low Back Pain & Neck Pain that may develop into chronic pain

3. Compressed Spines & Discs that may develop into Sciatica (pain radiating down the legs), Numbness or pins-and-needles in an arm or leg, etc.


Sitting on Zero-Gravity Upright Posture Cushion feels like skilled therapists' hands, correcting your sitting posture. Check it out.
  See the Difference!
  Sitting is not natural to the body. We can help you with ZGUP Cushion.
  Great Posture at the chairs not only helps your back and neck, but your sit bones & intervertebral discs (Discs between each spine). By evenly distributing weight and pressure of the body, your sitting is much more effortless; Your Spines & Hips will appreciate you at night.
 Zero Gravity Upright Posture Cushion ships with the mesh cover: anti-sweat cover (double layer mesh) that is breathable with great ventilation.
Memory foam is Visco foam that features:
Better contouring and pressure relief 
Better durability and a longer comfort life 
Better motion dampening 
More resistant to microorganisms and allergens
Highly resistant to bacteria, mold, mildew, mites, and other odor causing germs
Plus, the Visco Foam has semi-permanent durability. It won't deform unless you burn it.
        And... We Mean It.
Achieve optimal posture all day long with the Zero Gravity Upright Posture Cushion. This innovative seat helps to reduce fatigue, alleviate stress and pain, and even improve your mood. This is all thanks to the ergonomic design. This design cushions your body to help you sit upright naturally. In fact, it produces a weightless sitting experience so you can get up feeling revitalized. The ZGUP, as it’s affectionately called, works with virtually any chair and even on the floor. No matter where you sit, your body will thank you. Over time, the ZGUP helps you to improve your posture by strengthening your core muscles. As a result, you’ll reduce neck, shoulder, and back pain to power through your day. 
  The Human Body is rather simple to understand. When you sit, in most cases your pelvic girdle turns either forward or backward. We call it anterior pelvic tilt or posterior pelvic tilt. Whatever it does, by introducing the perfectly measured wedge, your spine and hips are supported from every possible angle. 
It is 3:1. That’s the magic ratio. You can try it out by putting a towel on your tailbone. Try it and wait 3 seconds. 1-2-3. Take a deep breath. You will feel the whole spines starting to let go of the tension. We wish you can feel it.
We use high quality memory foam to create the perfect angle and forgiveness regardless weight. We had 20 different formula for density, softness prototypes. Only 1 out of 20 is good enough for this particular cushion with the rare combination of functionality & comfort. You can apply this knowledge in your feet (insoles), knees, hips, and elsewhere on your body.
      This is the first step in our mission to bring comfort to everyone in the world. We would like to address a problem millions of people are experiencing every day: bad, uncomfortable chairs or seat cushions that affects their health, productivity, and happiness. Well... let's change that.
With the Zero Gravity Upright Posture Cushion, we are calling on our community of innovators & supporters on Kickstarter to help us launch this new, unique product. We can’t do this without your support, and that’s why we’ve come to Kickstarter, to share the first step in our comfort mission with you first. We want to put all we have learned over years of medical knowledge and passion into the world’s greatest ergonomic products. Thank you, again! 
 SOURCES (Check it out on Mashable, GadgetFlow, LifeHacker.ru)

Production time will be our biggest challenge, as we do make all of our products at our factory. However, we are guaranteeing the first 5,000 will be delivered by Christmas!

updates.update_userinfo: [ZGUP] FAQ 3 After 6 months of Field Testing
updates.update_content:
Hello, ZGUP Backers,
We have been monitoring/responding to comments and email responses. We would like to address a few of the most frequently asked questions in this update. Hopefully this helps out!
Please let us know what you think in the comment below:

updates.update_userinfo: [ZGUP] Great News with a quick Shipping Update!
updates.update_content:
Hello, Backers,
The initial responses are not that encouraging. Sorry for disappointments for some. It will definitely take a little bit of time for the body to get used to. You may initially feel resistant. Any CHANGES that's NEW to the body is naturally resisted. You may feel uncomfortable or painful even. It's the Natural Responses; it's like learning a new sport. 
Even for us, at first, we did not like it for a few days but now we have used it for 3 months, we can’t sit without it.

Hi Backers,
It's been a while since we have posted an update. We have some good news for you guys. 
We have finally shipped out our first batch today! We have shipped out about 1500 cushions today and you guys will be getting your tracking numbers over the weekend. 
Next week on Wednesday, we will be sending out another 1500 cushions and the week after, we will be sending out the rest. Our factory is producing about 1500 cushions a week and putting in full effort to deliver the best product to you guys. We do apologize for not meeting the Christmas date but we are trying our best to meet our timeline so please hang in there with us!

updates.update_userinfo: [ZGUP] FAQ after initial responses on KS Comments
updates.update_content:
Hi Backers,
We haven't been ignoring you guys, so we wanted to do a quick update on the surveys. The survey process has been delayed quite a bit and we do apologize for that. As we have told you guys before, we are using a third party platform BackerKit, and it is been causing some errors and particularly this one is bugging us right now.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As we learned during our first trial run, the largest obstacle was creating this transportation chain from the Andes Mountains to the US. We actually lost 60 sweaters when we were using a Peruvian postal service in our first shipment....... We have since switched to U.S. couriers and smoothed out our production process to make sure that we fulfill orders by the end of November (before all Holidays). We acknowledge that an unpredictable roadblock could happen, but we've traveled through a lot and are ready for it :)

- PAKA team
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
During the winter in Mongolia, temperatures drop to under -40C. In order to protect themselves from the environment, the animals develop superfine wool coats. The natural environment here and the traditional, nomadic, free-range way of raising the animals is what makes Mongolian cashmere the most sought after in the world.
Chillin' with his yak wool coat!
I'm pretty jealous of the goats and their coats. I've been living in Mongolia for 5 years. Originally as a Peace Corps volunteer and then coming back to do business development work, I've felt plenty of those -40 temps. I've got some history with the textiles industry here through a previous clothing label, and am using that experience to bring ULA+LIA international! I need Kickstarter's help to meet the shipping requirements to get some inventory for an online shop, so we are taking pre-orders at direct, wholesale prices!
Most of the 5 years I've lived in Mongolia have been spent in Mongolia's capital, Ulaanbaatar (UB). Sometimes, UB can get some hate for the issues a lot of developing cities have, which are mainly the traffic and the pollution that comes through in the winter. Problems aside, UB is cool, thriving, and has a pulse once you get to know it. It's always changing, and it's also the heart of manufacturing in Mongolia. Without Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia wouldn't work. 
I took this idea to the beginning of ULA+LIA. Natural, un-died fibers from the countryside turned into beautiful finish products in the capital, with a high-quality, durable finish. After using the fibers to stay warm through the harsh winters, animals shed their finest fibers in the spring. That's when herders sheer their sheep, or brush the yaks and goats to harvest their rare fibers. 
A herd of sheep and goats enjoying the summer
Most of these throws can also be worn as a sweet blanket scarf if you're brave enough! The beautiful fibers carry the Mongolian, nomadic soul, and the infusion of some urban refinement makes them perfect in any home. I personally guarantee you'll love it!
  Traditionally overshadowed by its softer wool companion, cashmere, Mongolian sheep's wool has been gaining popularity lately as domestic processing and production in Mongolia have developed enough to support the unique Mongolian wool. Originally, I didn't plan to use sheep wool with this label, but was shocked at the softness and quality of the wool blankets during development. Warm, soft, and durable, sheep's wool provides the Mongolian spirit at a lower price.
  Sheep Wool Throw - (150cm x 200cm / 59in x 78in)
    Sounds strange, but feels incredible. Exotic and less known than sheep's wool and cashmere, yak wool should actually be called yak cashmere. Being finer and softer than some cashmere from other countries, yak wool feels almost like a merino/cashmere blend.
Due to their unique habitat of high elevations and bitterly cold temperatures, yak wool is both very fine and soft, but also comprised of abnormally long and durable fibers. Even with my years of experience around cashmere and wools, I sometimes need to double check labels to confirm if it's yak wool and not cashmere.
Dark Chocolate Brown Yak Throw (150cm x 200cm / 59" x 78")
  Due to their relatively low numbers and limited supply, I'm promising 7 yak throws for immediate delivery, and the rest before the end of January. They will all probably get out with the first batch, but it might take me a little longer to get them all together. I'll make it happen, I just didn't want to over promise.
The ultimate in luxury. It's hard to put into words how incredible it is to cuddle up with a pure cashmere blanket! Mongolian cashmere is uniquely known for its softness and durability in international markets. Especially with the durable and sturdy woven construction, our blankets and throws are lightly brushed to soften the fabric, while the weave keeps it tightly held together. Cashmere items aren't generally seen as something you can pass down to your children, but if you give them a bit of care, they will be around indefinitely!
Cashmere Throw (180cm x 145cm / 71" x 57")
  Free Range Cashmere Goat in the Buff
  This is my favorite hat ever. It's thin enough to wear in the spring or fall, but warm enough to rock in the winter as well. Fold it over and double it up over your ears, or let it out flat for a relaxed look. Timeless! Doesn't matter if you're 16 or 60, this hat will be perfect. Same one I'm wearing in the videos! Will do some stretch goals for different colors, so let me know what you guys are interested in. I always recommend the pure, undyed colors because they are the softest, but sometimes you just can't beat a black beanie!
Heaven is wearing cashmere socks. These are cable knitted for strength and for incredible softness. I recommend wearing these around the home on a cold morning while sipping some coffee, but use 'em in your boots for extra warmth. Recommended for sizes 6-10. Makes an incredible gift!
      I know I come off a bit casual, but this campaign and business mean a lot to me. The plan for this brand and campaign is to not only develop into a larger business that I can pursue full time, but to also use it as a proof of concept for small Mongolian businesses to reach international markets. 
There are some great companies here with incredible products and unique stories behind them, but need a some cash and a bit of a customer base to get going abroad. I've worked for years doing business development here, and I already have 3 or 4 brands with incredible stories that I want to consult and partner with on kickstarter campaigns, and then work together with them to set up international distribution.
The products ULA + LIA sells also support the the nomadic herders and their lifestyle here in Mongolia. They are vulnerable to climate change and changing economics, and the international support can help to stabilize prices and protect their livelihood. 
THANK YOU for reading this far and for supporting the project. If you have any questions about Mongolia, the herders, cashmere, wool, yaks, ANYTHING, let me know! I can and will go on for hours!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
With half a decade of experience in Mongolia, I understand the business environment and the logistical challenges of working here. I've already met with my suppliers and confirmed that we will have items ready or be able to produce if needed.

I'm starting slow with my new label, but am confident I'll be able to get everything sent out on time. I have great support from my family back home, and they can always help with deliveries and exchanges if I'm in Mongolia!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hey everybody,
Long time no talk, but I hope everybody is doing well! I just wanted to send out a quick update to let you guys know that I’ve re-launched this campaign to try to build up some inventory for my website, www.ulaandlia.com. It’s a quick campaign so I have time to fulfill everything before April, when I’m planning to run a campaign for hand knitting yarn made with these same fibers. I hope everybody is enjoying their blankets, and please check out the current campaign if you might want to get another and see some new styles.

Hey guys,
I hope all the rewards are keeping you guys warm through the winter! I wanted to send out an update here to spread the word about a new project I put together to launch cashmere, yak wool, and camel wool knitting yarn.
Same idea as the throws, but you guys make the finished product this time! I'm facing pretty high minimums for spinning, so the project is a bit bigger than my first. Please check it out and help spread the word if you know any knitters. Thank you!!
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/1549499020/ula-lia-mongolian-yak-down-cashmere-and-camel-wool

Hey everybody,
I wanted to send out an update (i.e. small novel) to wrap up the campaign, give some behind the scenes info, give an update on ULA+LIA, and briefly introduce my next campaign (knitting yarn!)
First of all, if anybody hasn't received their packages yet, please let me know so we can work to sort it out. I THINK everybody has gotten their packages, but there might be one or two international backers that haven't received their items yet. It seems like it took up to two weeks for the packages to work their way through customs depending on the country, but I think everything has worked its way through by now. I had some issues uploading tracking numbers and matching them to backers, but I have all of them if you still need them.

Hey guys,
As of today, EVERYTHING is out! Got the last of the international shipments dropped off today. Most of the domestic (USA) shipments went out yesterday. I'm going to get the tracking numbers sent out this evening/tomorrow afternoon. Some of you might actually get your packages before I even get the numbers out.
Although I was nervous with timing, all of the yak wool stuff came in and I'm happy with how everything turned out. They were right out of production and then shipped over here, packaged again and shipped out, so feel free to be a little rough with them to get the fibers to open up, fuzz up a bit, and become a bit softer. Hitting them with some steam or doing a wash can help, or just slowly let them break in. Yak wool is super durable, so have fun growing into them :D Sometimes (especially yak) can keep some of the wool/animal scent on them after production, but that doesn't seem to be an issue with these at all!

Hey everybody,
Just wanted to let you all know that everything is officially out of production. Unfortunately, everything didn't finish before my flight back to the states, so I need to wait for it to get shipped over here before sending stuff out. Sending everything over here via DHL, and they are usually pretty quick with everything, so hoping to have everything in the states by the end of next week and can start pushing stuff out. Will still meet holiday delivery, so no worries! Attached a photo from the factory here with the lovely yak wool throws :D

updates.update_userinfo: cashmere hats and throws out/locking down orders and add-ons
updates.update_content:
Hello everybody,
Wanted to let you guys know that the cashmere hats and throws are out, and they are awesome! Really happy with the quality of everything. Still waiting for the yak wool items. They have been delayed a bit, but I'm being promised they will be out by this Wednesday, so crossing my fingers a bit there. 
On backerkit, I'm going to be locking down orders tomorrow. If you want to add on hats, socks, cashmere or yak throws, now's the time to do it! Thanks to those that have already added on.

Hey guys, sent the surveys out through backerkit to help keep everything together and streamline shipping. It's pretty basic since there aren't options and should just be addresses and add-ons, but please let me know if you have any question or issues.
I'm going to have different batches for shipping. I'm taking a trip back to the USA on the 16th of this month to visit family for thanksgiving and also handle distribution myself from there. For most customers not based in the US, I'm going to be sending directly from Mongolia before I leave for the states. International shipments should get delivered in 2-3 weeks after shipment, and US based customers should get everything around the end of this month/beginning of December as long as there aren't any issues with the remaining items coming out of production.

Hey everybody,
Just a bit of an update to show progress and let everybody know what's going on. So far, I have the cashmere socks and the sheep wool blankets out and ready. Cashmere throws, yak throws, and hats should all be ready in the next couple of weeks!

Thank you to everybody for their support. Going through the post-fundraising part for the first time, I'm still getting my bearings around kickstarter a bit. I've decided to use backerkit to help keep everything together. The FAQ advise me to wait for 2 weeks after the campaign ends and payments clear to send out the surveys, so it's easier to pinpoint any issues.
For production, everything is still in order to be out of the factories by early/mid-November, keeping in line for holiday deliveries. As long as I can get everything in the mail to international customers by the end of November, everybody will be having a super warm and comfy holiday season!

campaign.story:
Summary:
I will use a picture of your face to paint an original watercolor painting for you to keep.
What is this project about?
My painting career is just beginning and I want to share what I do with the world, while also getting to know more about myself as an artist and expand my artistic horizons.
This project is fundamentally based on my excitement for drawing and painting people. I am seeking to use your portrait to explore and grow my personal style and understanding of likeness. This project is not about creating formal portraits or copying photographs. I will be taking artistic liberties with the images that are provided to create my own interesting and personal visions.
How does it work?
Once the project is funded, I will send a request to all backers for a photo of a portrait of themselves or someone they know that they would like me to paint. As soon as I begin receiving pictures, I will be busy painting them based on the size corresponding to your pledge amount (either 5"x7", 8"x10", or 16"x20"). The paintings will then be shipped to you in a bubble mailer, attached to a mat board and inside an acid free plastic sleeve.

Examples of my work:
Why should you back this project?
As a backer of this project, you will not only be receiving an original piece of artwork at an astonishing price, but you will also be helping me to grow as an artist. I have tried to come up with pledge offers that are fair to the backer and myself, considering all the costs that are associated, from materials to packing and, of course, time. And don't forget that all United States backers' shipping costs are INCLUDED in the pledge amount for the 5"x7" and 8"x10" rewards.
If this project is successful, I have plans for more projects that are similar, possibly including some bigger reward opportunities. Keep in mind that this project will likely be priced at a considerably lower rate, as (I hope) my skill and demand increases.
Basic guidelines for your photo submission:
Simple background
Include your neck and all of your head/face
One person per photograph
Photographs should be clear representations of the person
All photographs are to be sent digitally
I must receive all photography within 30-days of completion of this kickstarter campaign.
Permissions:
All photography must be the rightful property of the person supplying the image. In the case that it is not your own photography you must have express permission from the photographer to use the image as mentioned above. By sending me your photograph, you are giving me permission to paint it. Photographs that do not follow the Basic Guidelines or for any reason are deemed unusable will be discarded and a new photograph will be requested. Refunds will not be given where a person fails to provide a working photograph as deemed by me, the artist.

About me:
I am from a small town in Western KY where I went to school at Murray State University, studying Music Education. I taught vocal music at a local high school for a couple years out of college. I found the experience to be both rewarding and, at times, frustrating. After my second year, I began to dabble in the field of graphic design, creating logos and a variety of advertising literature for various companies.
While I have always had an interest in art, I do not have any formal training. My dad, John McLaren, also an artist, has been a huge influence on me, encouraging me to join a local art gallery, which has been a very positive experience. I am always humbled and even surprised to find out that someone has purchased or commented on one of my paintings, as I have only really been painting since December of 2016.
Up until recently I have painted almost exclusively with soft pastels and love the vibrant colors that I can achieve with their use. I have since begun to dabble in watercolor and am already falling in love with the medium. I like the inherent "randomness" and unpredictability that you can achieve. As for subject matter, I tend to paint things that make me smile or laugh, and I especially love painting people.
Aside from painting, I currently manage a number of rental properties in the area and am a stay-at-home-dad to my nearly 2 year old daughter, Charlotte, who keeps me plenty busy. When I do have some free time, I am likely either painting or playing board games with friends and family.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I would say the biggest challenge for me is simply going to be time. While I don't have a standard full time job, I am a stay at home dad and have other responsibilities as does everyone. However, I have a very good idea of how long each painting will take me and have set a backer limit for each pledge to accommodate any time issues. I whole-heartedly believe I will be able to fulfill all orders before the deadline.

This is also my first Kickstarter project so there could be some hiccups that I have not forseen, but I feel I have done my research and have set myself up for success.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Thank you, thank you, thank you! Now the real work begins. You will soon be receiving surveys for shipping information and instructions on where to send your photo submissions. I will get started painting as soon as I start receiving your pictures! Assuming no major hiccups, I do anticipate being able to ship before the deadline, but will keep you updated on that front.
I can't tell you how excited I am to get started. I am truly humbled to see the support for this project. I already have some plans for my next one, but let's get these paintings done first!

Thank you so much for making this project a success! Can't wait to get started painting your portraits. As we get closer to the end of the campaign, be thinking about what image you would like to use for your portrait. Please see the basic guidelines for your photo submission on the main page. If you have any questions, don't hesitate to ask!
Also, for those of you who have expressed interest in getting more than one painting, don't forget to increase your pledge accordingly.

project_data.project_name: Watercolor Portraits of you and for you

campaign.story:
Blights Out for Mayor
*please scroll toward bottom to see images of our rewards!*
Last year, we ran for President. (Kinda.) Now, Blights Out is running for Mayor! (Sort of!) While Blights Out isn’t planning a collective occupation of the Mayor’s office (yet), we are launching a year-long creative campaign called ‘Blights Out for Mayor’––a series of 12 billboards and 5 yard sign designs that call for and suggest entry points into a Truth and Reconciliation process that would redress the racist/classist/disaster capitalist policies and values imposed after Hurricane Katrina. These messages seek to expand the horizon of our political imaginary, calling us to reevaluate our society’s relationship to property, land, and money. It is a call to action, a call to #PutHousingFirst.
Blights Out, "50 Years Later...(Blights Out for President)", 2016. Billboard inspired by the Black Panther Party 10-Point Program.
Why is our public visioning space taken up by ads for crank lawyers, liquor, guns, and politicians without platforms? While your political candidates might not have much to say about the state of ecology, affordable housing, gentrification, and debt in New Orleans and across our nation, WE DO! We are occupying billboard space on the corner of Orleans Avenue and Galvez Street in New Orleans’ 6th Ward starting NOW, just before the New Orleans Mayoral Election on October 14th and for one full year after. Each month, a fresh platform point will crop up, keeping public conversation popping... Because politics and policy neither begin nor end at the ballot.
Our messages will draw from conversations we've had with folks from the housing justice movement, our own research into how the system of development works (or doesn't work), and our Living Glossary project. Each billboard will seed the public's mind to receive the next message. Our preliminary billboard goes up in time with the Kickstarter so you can get a taste for things to come. With your support, we can reserve our billboard location for one full year and cover the costs of producing the billboard posters and yard signs.
Blights Out, Theater of the Gentrified Presents: "Auction", from the Living Glossary series (feat. Mariama Eversley), 2017.
 Why is this important?
Blights Out, "1731 Dumaine", 2016. Once 1731 Dumaine's roof caved in, demolition became inevitable. It is a stand-in for all of the lost former homes that were condemned to demolition-by-neglect.
Climate change is real. It is here. Yet our politicians are not acknowledging the major changes that we must make to save our cities from a future of ecological apartheid.
Across the world, wealth and power are reorganizing cities in their own image. After decades of disinvestment in urban centers, real estate developers have set their sites on the “inner city”, recognizing the immense profit to be made by converting disinvested neighborhoods into luxury developments. The phenomenon of gentrification is impacting cities across the US from New Orleans to Detroit, New York to San Francisco.
Blights Out, Commodified Housing is Class Warfare (Blights Out for President), 2016.
Gentrification is a product of end-game free market capitalism run rampant. Racist/classist policy, capitalist values and climate change are coming to a head. We must ask ourselves: will the future of our cities be gentrified fortresses that protect the wealthy from the rising-up of seas and people? We all must unite to demystify the forces behind this phenomenon and push ourselves, the public, and our representatives to act now to create permanently affordable housing, preserve local culture, and build sustainable communities for all. While this project will be rooted in New Orleans, its strategies, messages, significance, and impact will resonate everywhere.
Blights Out, “803 Spain (Faces of Gentrification series)", 2017. A blighted house in Marigny is repaired just enough to allow it to be photographed for market.
About Blights Out
Blights Out is a collective of artists, activists, architects, and concerned members of the public who seek to demystify and democratize the system of housing development and expose the policies that lead to gentrification. We have located the lynchpin of gentrification in laws governing debt and property, racialized boundaries, and wealth stratification. Our mission is to generate dialogue, art, and action that expose the policies that lead to and suggests ways out of our current housing crisis. We believe that art can envision, embody, and inspire better policy for people and the planet.
Blights Out meeting at Level Art Collective in 2015, prior to the ten-year anniversary of Katrina. Photograph by Bryan Tarnowski.
Blights Out was co-founded by native New Orleans artist/activist Imani Jacqueline Brown, New York-based artist Lisa Sigal, and native New Orleans artist Carl Joe Williams. The collective is led by the co-founders along with Founding Architectural Designer Bryan C. Lee, Jr. and Embedded Historian Mariama Eversley.
Why Kickstarter?
Blights Out, "Trauma/Resistance" (Blights Out for President), 2016. Billboard design for Blights Out's "Blights Out for President" campaign in 2016.
We recognize that the values that have created bad housing policy in New Orleans are the same values that are destabilizing cities across our nation. Gentrification is a national crisis of values and is the natural end of our society's refusal to redress our nation's founding values and laws, which justified the displacement, mass murder, and enslavement of indigenous and African people and their descendants. Blights Out is coming to Kickstarter to fundraise for this new project because we want to unite people in New Orleans and across our nation in a call to expose the roots of gentrification, address inequitable development as the root of systemic poverty and the expression of institutional racism, and declare that housing is a human right.
Rewards
Here is a small sampling of some of the rewards available as "thank you's" for your contributions to our campaign! Blights Out is immensely grateful to Katrina Andry, Ron Bechet, Garrett Bradley, Pippin Frisbie-Calder, Dave Mckenzie, Dread Scott, Lisa Sigal, John Isiah Walton, Carl Joe Williams, and Caroline Woolard & Jeff Warren for supporting us through your art! And thank you to Zac Manuel of The Greenhouse Collective for filming our video!
Alex Ross
Alex T. Ross, Common Birds of New Orleans, 2016. Zine. 40pp. $25

Kevin Isaac Brisco, Jr., Tyler Perry Film Stills (Left: "Daddy's Little Girls 1-3"; Right: "Diary of a Mad Blackwoman #1-3"), 2015. Oil on panel. Series of 6. 10" x 8" each. Each $100

updates.update_userinfo: We did it! Blights Out for Mayor is fully funded!

updates.update_content:
Hey folks,
We are so excited to announce that two of our favorite artists and dear friends Kevin Isaac Brisco, Jr. and Heather Hart have generously donated new work as rewards for pledges to our Kickstarter! Each of Kevin's gorgeous oil paintings (6 available) is available as a reward for a $100 donation. Heather's resplendent single print (an artist's proof from a limited edition of 10) is a reward for a $1,000 donation. If you are cursing yourself (or us!) for missing this opportunity, we think it's possible to go back and either adjust your donation or to select a reward if you donated $100 or $1,000 but didn't choose a reward initially. Send us a message and we'll work it out together.

Y'all!
You helped us to reach our 5-day goal in just 1 day! Your support is instrumental to reaching our goal of occupying a billboard with radical visioning that will stimulate the public imaginary in time for and for one year after the mayoral election. Thank you for recognizing that politics neither begin nor end at the ballot, but must be ever grounded in an ongoing, challenging, and creative dialogue in our public sphere!

campaign.story: Here at Chili Wonkaz Pepper Factory, LLC we our aiming to gain a national footprint with our artisan hot sauce collection. By reaching our goal we will be able to immediately start commercial production of our exceptional sauces in a state of the art commercial production and packaging facility. we have three sauces we want to introduce. Kicked up "Q"(a sweet medium heat bbq sauce), MXM ORIGINAL SAUCE(A tasty mild sauce), and "H" BOMB SAUCE(a hot sauce made with peaches and habaneros.) Our recipes have already been tested, approved, and our manufacturer is awaiting the green light from us to begin production immediately. That means once our goal is reached we will be able to introduce our sauces into grocery stores, local markets, restaurants, and direct online sales so that the consumer has easy access to our products. Each pledge received will go to continuing research and development of the production process to find the most efficient way to produce the sauces and cover the costs that the manufacturer requires to begin production(Bottles, ingredients, labels, packaging, and labor). it will also go towards creating a more professional product label that will meet all FDA requirements. Every pledge helps tremendously and i want to personally thank each and everyone that has, and each one that  will help us along on our journey.Thank you very much!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We are ready to begin production immediately upon finishing this campaign! once production begins we will be able to distribute rewards to everyone that has pledged! I guarantee these sauces are so good they will blow your mind!

campaign.story:
100% reusable cleaner. A special shape, developed with european industrialists.
   Our basis idea was to answer an everyday life problem that affects everyone. By doing our research, we came across these overwhelming numbers ...
The ecological impact of our project took place. This reinforced us in the idea that we were on the right way. 
To have an idea of cotton swabs' impact on our Planet.
     In 2018, France will be the first country to prohibit the plastic cotton swabs sale.
           The classic cotton swab is an archaic and sometimes even a dangerous tool. There is no real alternative in this business.
Eeears VS Classic cotton swab.
  We developed 3 unique colors. 
3 solo. 3 colors available.
    One solo pack & one solo unboxed.
  One, two, three solo...
    Trio Pack. 3 colors included.
  Safety is our priority. We worked with medical 3D softwares to simulate our project on 3D ears.We develop the product and the first prototypes with French manufacturers specialized in medical equipment. The aim is to use the best silicone possible. The one used for teats, baby’s bottles, prothetis...
We develop the product and the first prototypes with French manufacturers specialized in medical equipment. The aim is to use the best silicone possible. The one used for teats, baby’s bottles, prosthesis ... 
The user's safety is at the heart of our concerns. Thanks to its shape and length, Eeears will never touch the eardrum. 
                 Travel with Eeears.
     Eeears in your bath.
  Eeears for sports people.
       An african proverb says : "Work alone, you will go faster. Work in team, you will go further".
The 2 Eeears' creators.
  I will do my best to respect this Timeline. I Have already chosen my partners on this project.

10 DAYS LEFT FOR THE PROMO CODE : EeearsV1
www.eeearsofficial.com

Dear backers
First of all, thank you very much for your support !
We just wanted to let you know that two New rewards are now available with free shipping for the V2. 
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/1148111582/eeears-20-reusable-ear-cleaner-safer-and-greener/description

Hi Everyone,
I'm Kaoutar the new member of Eeears. We may had been in contact by mail, comment and message recently. 
After reading all your message (on the both campaign :) ), i thought we need to do more for you.

Dear backers, 
We would like to bring to your attention that EEEARS is currently only made available through Kickstarter platform and no further commercialisation will be made until the release of the new version. 
Any offer elsewhere bearing EEEARS, “Easier” or any other name is simply a counterfeit. Further updates will follow regarding progress on the new version.

Dear backers, 
Thank you for your comments so far and feedback provided via the survey.
We are sorry that some of you feel dissatisfied at the moment with the product received and cease this opportunity to also offer sincerely apologies for any inconvenience suffered due to delays with regards to the delivery.

Dear Backers,
Many thanks for reaching out to us via your various comments and emails.
We understand that few concerns/questions have been raised and we will endeavour to address each one as soon as possible.  In the meantime, we would be very grateful for your feedback in the form of a brief satisfaction survey via this link ( https://fr.surveymonkey.com/r/PHJGRPY ) which will equip us with the right information to provide satisfactory adjustments and progress.

campaign.story:
#Important news: We released a 3rd wave "FREE base 5Pack" reward in which you can get 5 E.P.Light with one FREE light base !!! 
#Important news: We are now offering light holders at $19 AUD, please see more details further down the page !!
.
A Project for creative minds, and for Earth
Light bulb is one of the most important invention in human history, therefore bears many historical meanings. You can see light bulb symbols all the time as energy saving logo, environmental protection logo, green Earth logo, etc.  But nothing comes more vivid than actual light bulb. 
So we decided to make a piece of art using common light bulb. Our artistic inspiration came from the works of another most creative minds of 20th century, Jackson Pollock. So we named our product: E.P.Light, in honor of Mr.Thomas Edison and Jackson Pollock.
We are showing some of the works of Jackson Pollock here only for art history reference purpose
 Please see more details in the Green Earth Gift Card section
.
   E.P.Light is a ambient light made from light bulbs with environmental-friendly injection inside. Sounds pretty simple right? But the art comes in, when the paint and colorful fluid get mixed inside as the stuffing. Once the solidification complete, one beautiful moment will be captured, forever, as a piece of art.
  160g version sideway position
  160g version sideway position
  250g version head-down position
.

For E.P.Light project creator contact, you can email: E_P_LIGHTWORKSHOP@YEAH.NET
However for backing item notes, please contact us via kickstarter message, for reward records.

Here are some charts for you to get a better idea of how the light base works:

Please note that each E.P.Light is unique and can be quite different. The actual color and paint curve inside is totally random and unique, since we treat every E.P. Light as a piece of art.  
You can buy the light bulb with the base, or without it. If you want the the base, just increase your pledge by $18 AUD.
You can also buy the light bulb with a light holder. If you want the the base, just increase your pledge by $19 AUD.
Light holder for E.P.Light
    Please note the currency exchanging rate varies all the time. The chart is only for reference.
.
.
A project for Green Earth
Symbol for energy saving: As the most influential invention in the second wave of industrial revolution, light bulb is one the most common used as symbol for all sorts of energy saving logos. And no logo comes more vivid than an actual beautiful light bulb. 
The idea is simple: If you back this project, you will find a green Earth theme gift card in your package. And when you give out E.P.Light as a gift, you are also spreading the idea of energy saving. We are sure that your loved ones will have a much deeper impression of green Earth .
.
.
    Specs for Light bulb: 0.5W LED,  110V~220V.
Specs for base: 2W LED, with wire plug
For more infomation, click to see our update#3
  .
.
.
   Production Plan
Gathering order info: For two weeks, we shall wait for backers to answer their survey. Please note that backers are always change their address for our survey, however do shoot us an message when you about to do so. And do let us know ahead of time if you are moving. Kickstarter can be a long march :( 
Confirm order and buy materials: For this step we shall start calculating the material we need and start ordering them. 
Manufacturing: We shall work with our contractors and start making products. Tell from experience that timing could be on and off for this stage, you never know. But even if you are off the schedule, please understand that we are only trying to make sure the products are of good quality. 
Packaging: Packaging can be quite challenging as well, since we have backers from all over the world. Have to be careful. :) 
Shipping: Please note that our estimated delivering date is the shipping date, not arriving date. Shipping time could be quite different depends on the locations of each backer.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
1. On timing: 
Since the exact number of backers is unknown to us, so the timing may fall out of schedule a little. But we did leave ourselves with extra time already, and we will try to get ahead of time for each step, so don't worry. :)

2. On shipping: 
Shipping is another potential problem as well. Should the shipping take way too long than regular time, we will assume the package is lost and resend the reward. Promises promises :)

3. On refund: 
We will arrange refund, if it is strongly insisted. There is no point in keeping the money from backers if they don't have our back any more. We will do our best to meet backers' anticipation as we should, and hope the worst won't happen.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Dearest backers,
2nd wave shipping
We have been working on repackaging the lights. We had quite some delay due to local holiday season, but we should be able to start shipping out 2nd wave lights in about one week. In this wave, about 25% more backers would receive tracking info.

hey, dearest backers,
Official site alive

Www.epdesignlab.com
Shipping issues

Hey guys,
The backer reward sorting process was quite difficult, but we are moving forward, and have been making solid progress:

updates.update_userinfo: Address change backer heads up!! Please change your address records !!
updates.update_content:
hey, guys
We have been receiving a lot of address changing requests, this is quite understandable in this time of the year. But it is very difficult for us to process hundreds of such requests from messages. Again, messages works like side memos, it is the survey record that really counts.
Therefore, we will be open the "allow address change" button on all reward levels, please change your shipping address from there, and the deadline is Sunday. Since there will a 48hour reminder, there will be an email sending out on Friday informing you guys that we are about to close the "allow address change" function.

updates.update_userinfo: E.P.Light report: Sorry about the delay, we are working hard with packaging !
updates.update_content:
hey, guys,
Sorry about the delay, although our team are willing to give up our new year holiday, but we still can't fight the world, we had some delay in preparing the products, and we just finished the product boxing. 
As you can see below, each E.P.light has a black product gift box, we worked hard to get all the boxing done (almost 4 thousands of them), and the next step is postal packaging.

updates.update_userinfo: Some delay in testing and boxing, but we are making great progress. And deadline for survey answering.
updates.update_content:
Dear backers,
We are wrapping up the products gift boxes. Marking the them with color category, testing inspection etc. It is taking a little more time than we expected, however, we are moving forward with great progress, and should be able to ship out around 3/4 backers.   
.

updates.update_userinfo: Good News! We are almost ready for the first wave shipping
updates.update_content:
Hey, guys 
We are here with great news!
Production process
  After many rounds of trial and error with our suppliers, we are excited to announce that we are almost there for the first wave shipping :) We will do our best to include as many backer as possible, but backers who answered survey relatively late will probably have to wait for the second wave shipping, which will also be shipped out in no time.

updates.update_userinfo: Great news: We are really making great progress with production !!
updates.update_content:
hey, guys,
Recently, we have been very busy working with our suppliers, designing manufacturing techniques, and we are making great progress :)

hey, guys,

Please use this update as reference while filling survey. :)

We were working hard in our workshop labs and suppiler factories to come up with a doable plan and adjusting our survey system to meet your requirements.
So in our final plan, there are 4 factors determine the outcome of each light bulb: Painting technique, theme color, 2nd theme color, other colors. So things come down to two basic elements: Painting technique and color options

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Yes, unfortunately running a business and producing flat bottles can come with various risks. There is always inherent risk when bringing new products to market. Production delays can occur, and we are first to admit that we have definitely experienced them before. This is our second Kickstarter campaign, and the experience we gained 3 years ago (and the journey since) has been invaluable for the planning of this campaign. We are now well versed in the production process, and have taken all steps to ensure the process goes as smoothly as possible. 

But we don't like over-promising something - so here's a few potential risk areas, and how we have mitigated them. 

- Bottle production - quality. In our first campaign we hit a number of roadblocks - learning how to produce flat bottles with an offset neck, whilst maintaining good clarity and quality. There were months of back and forth with samples before we finally arrived at the final product. This time, we have done this grunt work in the lead up to this campaign, and have strong existing manufacturer relationships in place. 

- Soft good production - Manufacturing soft goods also has it's challenges. Maintaining a consistent quality of leather, fitment and stitching requires serious expertise. We've teamed up with Melbourne fashion label Kinnon to ensure that quality of the leather sleeves is top notch.

- Shipping and logistics - setting up a logistics system to effectively and efficiently ship to backers all over the world is not easy - and is a hugely time consuming process. After shipping to 72 countries in our previous campaign, we now have an established logistics network of 9 warehouses around the world
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: We are back... almost! A special offer and exciting things to come.
updates.update_content:
Hello Kickstarter Backers!
From all of us at membottle, we hope that you are all staying safe and looking after yourself during these uncertain times.
It has been a while since we have done an update. We have been working hard to get through the economic downturn, but have also taken this time to reflect on our mission and our product road map. We are excited to say that we will be launching a new Kickstarter Campaign later in the year. Unfortunately, we have to keep the details a secret for now.. But you’ll receive updates soon enough! We also have a string of product releases coming over the next couple of months.

campaign.story:
Would you like to read this in your language? We've created translations in Deutsch, Español, Français, Italiano, Nederlands, Türkçe, 繁體中文, 简体中文, Português & Português Brasileiro, 日本語 and ภาษาไทย!
The Lomo’Instant Automatic Glass Spark Burn Snap Crackle Pop Dusk Dawn Doodle Ticket-To-Ride Aphrodisiac Sharp Shiver Dare Sugar Spice Yodel Dance Discombobulate Haphazard Compact Smart Focus Flash Blush Bumfuzzle Kerching Kerfuffle Unlimited Fabulous Festoon Forever-Or-Never Crave Colors Shenanigans Shrubbery Serendipity Shake Share Square Camera.
Introducing the fully analogue Lomo'Instant Square: one square frame, make it your ticket to anywhere and everywhere.
  The Lomo'Instant Square is the world’s first fully analogue camera to work with Fujifilm Instax Square Film. It features a 95mm glass lens for super sharp photos, an advanced automatic mode that makes sure every shot is perfectly exposed, as well as tons of creative features — unlimited multiple exposures, a self timer, a portrait glass lens attachment and stacks more. There’s even a remote control shutter release tucked away in the camera body, which you can whip out whenever you need to shoot from the center of the action.
UPDATE: The Lomo’Instant Square is Now a Multi-Format Master 
An advanced automatic mode, a super sharp glass lens and a ton of funky features is not all this super creative camera has got to offer. Thanks to the incredible support from the Kickstarter community, we’re introducing the Lomo'Instant Square Instant Mini Back to transform your Lomo’Instant Square into a multi-format master. With double the features, it’s double the fun!
One camera – two instant formats!
The Instant Mini Back clips onto the Lomo’Instant Square to make this foldable box of creativity work with Fujifilm Instax Mini Film as well as Fujifilm Instax Square Film! That means you’ll get all the super sharpness, perfect exposure and funky features of the Lomo’Instant Square on two different film formats. Make sure you add a Lomo’Instant Square Instax Mini Back to your pledge from our Add-On Menu for just 15 USD!
The Lomo’Instant Square is a response to consistent, popular demand from analogue lovers worldwide hungry to try out the iconic square format, and a multi-format master designed to stretch your creativity. With a compact, foldable design that comes in five different colors, the Lomo’Instant Square is a box full of creativity that fits right into your life. It’s the sum of everything we’ve learned through our years developing instant cameras, our interaction with our community, and our seven previous Kickstarter campaigns — all tied up with a dose of good madness.
Take your life and tint it, frame it, share it, shake it, scream it — yodel like no one's listening — upside down, loud and clear. When it gets dark, make it brighter. Enjoy little things: one day you may look back and realise they were the big things. Start with the ordinary — the extraordinary will take care of itself.
All editions of the Lomo'Instant Square from left to right: Kickstarter, Black, Pigalle, Ginza, White
      We’ve packed the Lomo’Instant Square full of creative features so that you can stuff your squares with artistic antics. With unlimited multiple exposures, color gel flash filters, a remote control shutter release and more, you’ve got everything you need to shoot awesome instant snaps.
 Square Format: Works with Fujifilm Instax Square Film to give you a perfectly balanced frame with a scale of 1:1 — the iconic format that made instant photography what it is today. It dares you to make your subject the center of the universe, and leaves plenty of space for creative composition.
Auto Mode: Automatically adjusts shutter speed, aperture and flash output; and makes sure that your shots are perfectly exposed. It works with fixed apertures of f/10 and f/22. 
Glass Lens: Takes super sharp shots bursting with detail, and has a focal length of 95mm (45mm equivalent).
A close-up of the 95mm glass lens of the Lomo'Instant Square
Foldable Bellows Design: Looks super cool and lets you reduce the Lomo’Instant Square to a third of its size. 
LED Exposure Counter: 10 lights for 10 Instax frames. One light goes out every time you take a shot, letting you keep track of just how many frames you have left.
 Self Timer: Gives you time to run, jump, grab your best friend and strike a pose. 
Remote Control Shutter Release: Snaps your shutter from afar so that you can focus on diving into the good madness, and slots into the camera body for safe keeping.
 Exposure Compensation: Lightens or darkens your frame so that you can be master of your own destiny.
Built-In Flash & Flash Off Mode: Lets you decide just how much light you want to shine on your shenanigans.
Multiple Exposure Mode: Lets you layer up the loco by exposing one frame as many times as you like.
Long Exposure Mode: Keeps your shutter open for as long as 30 seconds so that you can unleash your creativity in crazy light paintings.
Color Gel Flash Filters: Slide over your flash to tint your squares a whole new color — everything you need to ride the rainbow! 
Shooting Tip Cards: 25 ways to keep the inspiration rolling. Give them a try and then see what else you can come up with!
Extras: Photo clips, photo stands, glue dots and magnet stickers to display your super square frames. 
And if you pledge for a Combo Package, you’ll also get:
Portrait Glass Lens Attachment: Perfectly frames the beautiful faces of your favorite people — whether they’re laughing, dancing, snoozing or tumbling. It has a closest focusing distance of 0.5m, and also snaps super sharp pictures at 0.8m if you twist the focusing ring to infinity.
Shot with the Lomo'Instant Square Portrait Lens Attachment at 0.5m
Splitzer: Splits your shot into segments so that you can create a kaleidoscope.
    As a great big thank you for all the incredible support our Kickstarter campaign has received, we’re adding a bunch of extra goodies to every Lomo’Instant Square package for every stretch goal we reach!
We’ve powered past $500,000, meaning that everyone who’s pledged for a Lomo’Instant Square will get four extra Color Gel Flash Filters to go with the four already included! Slide these colorful little strips slides over the flash to tint your frame a whole new hue.
Help us hit the $600,000 mark and we’ll add an orange lens filter to every Lomo’Instant Square pledge package!
The Lomo’Instant Square is dedicated to all the extraordinary ordinary people who keep this world turning. We’re talking about the free spirits who can’t live unless they’re spattering the earth with crazy ideas and irresistible energy. We sent the Lomo’Instant Square to actors, tattoo artists, musicians, photographers, entrepreneurs; anyone we could find who was giving their all to creating something amazing. Here’s what we got back.
Zach Carothers, Member of Portugal. The Man, Touring the World
“I’m in love with the Lomo’Instant Square. Compact, instant and fun. The energy in a space or a party steps up every time I pull out the camera. It brings people together. I’m all about the pictures taken with it. There is something so beautiful about right angles and equal sides. Classic framing that brings me back to my childhood. The glass is so much sharper and easier to control. Very excited to get into this more.”
  Makui and Chow, Founders of Café Mum's Not Home, Hong Kong 
“Everything about instant photography is filled with expectation and excitement. We enjoy the mixture of emotions as you wait for the photo to develop. We‘ve always loved the square format because it’s balanced, which makes it look more perfect.”
Ruby June, Artist and Photographer, New York 
“It's amazing to be able to capture a moment and have it in my palm immediately — ready to write the memory down while it's still fresh. When I used to bring my digital camera with me I had to take a thousand photos and it was really hard to stay present. With the instant camera I have maybe five shots that I can use. If they turn out great! If they don't, that's a memory too.”
Naomi Perkins, Tattoo Artist's Manager, New York
“The Lomo'Instant Square is really fun and easy to use. Having the physical copy of a photo is so much cooler than just having it in your phone. Michelle and I immediately started talking about taking photographs of her with clients and making a backdrop out of them. It would be so cool! I love the way Sheena’s hair and tattoos look in the film—so detailed! When I first saw the Lomo’Instant Square I thought it was a reaaaaaally old camera. Carrying it around would catch attention and I think a lot of people would be curious to know more about it!”
Luca Font, Tattoo Artist and Illustrator, Milan
“I choose to shoot people who do interesting things. Taking a picture of them is, in some way, showing a small instant of what is happening in Milan in 2017. The Lomo’Instant Square is very intuitive and user-friendly. I feel that the shots reflect the subjects' personality in a true and efficient way. Whether in instant or 120 format, there’s something deeply fascinating about square photography that I’ve never been able to explain!”
Russell Darling, Michael Hanratty and Hector Moss; Filmmaker and Actors; London
“I love the raw, edgy, provocative, crazy and beautiful images that Andy Warhol and Robert Mapplethorpe created in the 1970s. I took inspiration from them, and from movies such as Eyes Wide Shut. The square format is perfect for portraits, as it allows for an up-close intimate window into the world of that person. It was also very satisfying to see the photos right away and share them with my subjects, Michael Hanratty and Hector Moss.”
  The Lomo’Instant Square automatically adjusts shutter speed, aperture and flash output to make sure that your shots are perfectly exposed — no matter where you’re exploring or what you’re discovering. Thanks to the high-quality 95mm glass lens, each of your frames will be bursting with crystal-clear, razor-sharp detail; and rendered in stunning high resolution.
  Film Format: Fujifilm Instax Square Film
Exposure Area: 62mm x 62mm
Lens Focal Length: 95mm (45mm equivalent) 
Auto Exposure Type: Programmed Automatic
Aperture: Automatic f/10, f/22
Shutter Speed: Bulb Mode up to 30 sec, Auto Mode 8s to 1/250
Exposure Compensation: +1/-1 Exposure Values (Ambient Exposure)
Film Ejection Mechanism: Motorized
Multiple Exposures: Unlimited
Built-In Flash Guide Number: 9 (m)
Built-In Flash: Automatic Flash & Flash Off Mode
Closest Focusing Distance: 0.8m 
Zone Focusing Setting: 0.8m / 1-2.5m / infinity (pre-set at 1-2.5m)
Tripod Mount: Yes
Remote Control Transmission: Infrared (front & back sensors on camera)
Self Timer: Electronically controlled countdown to 10 seconds
Film Counter: LED indication, counting down
Battery Supply: 2 x CR2 batteries (6V) — please note that batteries are not included 
Remote Control Battery Supply: CR2025 (3V) — please note that batteries are not included
Filter Thread Diameter: 30.5mm 
Lens Attachments: Portrait Glass Lens (closest focusing distance 50cm), Splitzer. Available in combo packages.
Early sketches of the Lomo'Instant Square
  2D drawings of the Lomo'Instant Square
  3D drawings of the Lomo'Instant Square
    We love sharing our projects with you right from the very beginning. That’s why we’re regulars on the Kickstarter scene. We get to hear what you think and make sure that the final product we produce is everything you need. 
We’ve worked out a timeline of production so that you can see exactly how we’ll be bringing the Lomo’Instant Square to life, and we promise to keep you right up to date with our progress. Pledge now to join the journey! 
   All you need to do to start framing stories with the Lomo’Instant Square is follow these three simple steps…
From every Lomography instant camera ever created to a trip to Lomography Headquarters in Vienna, our pledge packages are packed with fantastic photography treats. Take a look at the list below and choose your favorite!  
  Push your creativity even further with the amazing extras on our Add-On Menu! Choose as many as you like by simply adding the amount specified for each of your chosen items to your pledge. For example, if you’ve pledged for the KICKSTARTER SPECIAL Kickstarter Combo Package at 186 USD, and you’d like to add a Lomography Light Painter to your pledge at 7 USD, just increase the amount you’ve pledged to 193 USD.
Please don’t forget to send us a message detailing everything you’ve pledged for, and a follow-up message every time you update your pledge. That way we can make sure you receive exactly what you ordered!
A Few of Our Favorites
Lomorello DIY Albums
Tell a story with your square, wide or mini Instax frames by pasting them into one of these accordion-style photo albums! They’re perfect for anyone with a brand new Lomo’Instant Square, a Lomo’Instant Wide, or a classic Lomo’Instant.
2 Packs of 2 Mini: 14 USD
2 Packs of 2 Square: 21 USD
2 Packs of 2 Wide: 24 USD
The Lomorello DIY Albums from left to right: Wide, Square, Mini
Watch this Space for the Lomo'Instant Square Bag! 
We’re working on a super stylish bag that’ll be custom made to fit your Lomo’Instant Square. Keep an eye on our page for more updates. We can’t wait to share the finished product with you!
Drawings of the Lomo'Instant Square Bag, stay tuned for more infos!
Check out our full Add-On Menu and boost your pledge package now: https://microsites.lomography.com/lisq-addons/
  Once you’ve finished topping up your pledge with extras, added the relevant shipping fees for your tier and clicked the “Pledge” button, your pledge will be processed. After the end of the campaign, we’ll send you a survey asking for your shipping address and a list of everything you pledged for. Once you’ve filled this in and sent it back, we’ll get your items in the post as soon as they’re ready. The money you’ve pledged will be reserved on your account, but only booked once the campaign is successfully funded and over.
  The Lomographic Society International is a globally-active organization dedicated to experimental, creative and analogue photography. With a range of innovative cameras and photographic accessories, heaps of Gallery and Embassy Stores, a fantastic photographic magazine, and a thriving online community with over a million members, Lomography promotes photography as a creative approach to communicate, absorb and capture the world. Kick off your Lomographic adventure today! 
  The Lomo'Instant Square will be available for delivery to most countries around the world. As shipping, handling and local charges (excluding customs fees) vary from country to country, please select your reward to see specific details about your location. Lomography cannot be held liable for any additional customs charges that may occur in your location. We have logistics hubs in Hong Kong, Japan, China, New York and Hungary. This means that we can deliver to customers from the EU, USA, China, Hong Kong, or Japan without incurring additional customs fees when you receive your reward. If you are located outside the EU, USA, Hong Kong, China, or Japan, there may be extra import costs to pay upon delivery.
We're offering "drop shipping" to backers in Thailand, which means that there will be no additional importation costs to pay upon receipt of your items. The shipping rates for Thailand will vary depending on the total cost of your pledge — please find a complete list of the shipping costs per pledge in our FAQ section. These shipping rates include all import and handling fees.
For all shipping and handling details, please refer to the FAQs. If you are interested in backing the project but your country isn’t listed in the dropdown menu upon checkout, or if you have any further questions about shipping, please feel free to contact us.
                                   P.S.: We’re currently having a blast celebrating 25 Years of Lomography. Head to the Lomography Magazine to find out how you can join the party and win some amazing prizes! We’re always on the lookout for exciting new people to join the Lomography team, too. Whether you’re a store, a distributor, or a creative, check out our jobs page or get in touch with us here to discuss opportunities!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We’re proud to have successfully funded and completed seven ambitious Kickstarter projects. We’re working hard to bring the Lomo'Instant Square to life, but we’re aware that there’s always an element of risk involved in these kinds of projects.

We’re dedicated to delivering a flawless creative camera that fulfills your expectations. Our commitment to excellence means that the first shipment is set to go out in January 2018. Although we work closely with our manufacturers to ensure everything runs smoothly, unexpected delays in production and therefore delivery are always a possibility. We promise to keep you informed every step of the way.

We’re so ready for this exciting challenge, and we hope you’ll join us in making the Lomo'Instant Square a reality!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Introducing the Lomography Atoll Ultra-Wide 2.8/17 Art Lens
updates.update_content:
Hey there!

We have some exciting news to share!

We have just launched the Atoll Ultra-Wide 2.8/17 Art Lens on Kickstarter. Add to your Lomography collection and embrace a whole new perspective with this compact prime lens boasting an impressive ultra-wide 103º field of view and closest focusing distance of just 0.1 m. Optimized for photo and video, the Atoll Ultra-Wide Art Lens delivers eye-popping colors and stunning saturation.

updates.update_userinfo: Last Chance to Back the Lomography Petzval 80.5 mm f/1.9 MKII SLR Art Lens!
updates.update_content:
The time is now! You have a bit over 72 hours left to get your mitts on the Petzval 80.5 mm f/1.9 MKII SLR Art Lens at a very delicious 30% off its retail price. A remarkable tool for filmmakers and photographers alike, here’s why this lens is like no other:
We've assimilated the coveted 19th Century Aesthetic into a (d)SLR lens optimised for still
and motion photography.
With a helicoid focusing mechanism and stopless aperture diaphragm you can focus and f-stop whilst the camera is rolling.

updates.update_userinfo: The First New Color Negative Film in over 5 Years!
updates.update_content:
Greetings loyal Lomo'Instant Square backers, we hope your box of instant inspiration is treating you well and that you’re treating it well! We noticed that there is still some room left on your bedroom walls for instant masterpieces, so here are some fresh stories from our magazine to ignite your next artistic endeavors.  
Anne Hollond's Technicolor Nudes Series
Fun Times in Singapore
Sarah Longworth and the Lomo'Instant Square Glass

updates.update_userinfo: A New Pentax K Mount & Only One Week Left to Back the Lomogon!
updates.update_content:
Hello, lovely people!
Time flies and our 10th Kickstarter project, the Lomogon 2.5/32 Art Lens, is coming to a close. There’s only a few days left to make it your own with a fierce 30% discount on its final retail price. Reproducing the beloved aesthetics of the Lomo LC-A with cutting-edge optical quality, and equipped with a super-speedy dial aperture, it’s the ultimate Lomo eye on the world.

updates.update_userinfo: Your daily dose of square inspiration, and more!
updates.update_content: What’s up, instant fans? We hope you’re enjoying your Lomo’Instant Square Glass so far. Packed with creatives features, it’s perfect for casual snapshots as well as artistic ones. Take a look at Anne Hollond’s Technicolor Nudes series on our Magazine – using collage, Hollond expresses body positivity through wonderfully colorful square frames.

updates.update_userinfo: Last 24 Hours to Snap Up the Diana Instant Square
updates.update_content: Hello, lovely Lomo'Instant Square backer! We just thought we’d swing by your inbox to remind you that our latest Kickstarter campaign is about to come to an end. This is your last chance to save a massive 30% on the Diana Instant Square, now a Pinhole camera too!

updates.update_userinfo: Brand New Content and Some Super Exciting News
updates.update_content: Hey there, square format superstars! We’ve loved looking at all your incredible instant frames, and we can’t wait to see what you do next. Pocket-sized and packed with creative potential, the Lomo’Instant Square is perfect for street photography. Head to our Magazine to take a look at photographer Tim Nesmith’s gorgeous Parisian scenes — beautifully candid shots taken on Fujifilm Instax Square Film.

updates.update_userinfo: Starting from Square One Winner and More Square News!
updates.update_content:
Whaddup y’all,
Have you heard about the brand new Wide-Angle Glass Lens Attachment for the Lomo’Instant Square? If not, you’re in for a wide-angle wonder of a treat today!

updates.update_userinfo: But First, Let Me Take a Square Selfie
updates.update_content:
What’s up Lomo’Instant Square backers,
We’ve got a brilliant new Lomo’Instant Square competition just for you!
The selfie revolution may have emerged during the digital age, but that doesn’t mean it should stay that way. Forget selfie sticks and smartphones, your Lomo’Instant Square features a discrete little mirror next to the shutter release which is ideal for taking picture perfect selfies.

Well hello there Lomo’Instant Square backers,
We’re absolutely loving the square shots we’ve received so far! We simply can’t wait for the rest of you to get on board when you get your hands on your Lomo’Instant Squares.
If you haven’t received your new square sidekick yet: don’t worry! You’re at the very top of our list, and you have priority over all Online Shop Pre-orders. All orders have been processed and are on their way to you as you read this!

campaign.story:
Hi, I'm Dave Kellett, and I'm making a hardcover collection of comics called ANATOMY OF ANIMALS! It's a series of goofy animal comics that have been running on my webcomic SHELDON. And now it's time to collect them into a super cool hardcover!
"Anatomy of Animals" is a hilarious take on High School biology charts...but instead of pointing out where the "thorax" is, we're gonna learn truly important things like: Do turtles stay in shape? How do crabs do on Tinder? And hey...is that Platypus down to watch some Gilmore Girls with you? (Answer: They are super down.) 
These comics are 100% free to read on the site, so check 'em out! I recommend reading Lion, Tardigrade, Rhino, or even the Bony-Eared Assfish (...it's a real fish, mom!). 
  104-PAGE HARDCOVER BOOK
PRINTED IN FULL COLOR
DIMENSIONS: 10 3/4” x 8 1/4” (273mm x 209mm)
WRAPPED IN A FANCY-SHMANCY CLOTH SPINE
INTERIOR LAYOUT WILL LOOK LIKE A 1910/20'S BOOK
YOU GUYS...IT'S GONNA LOOK SO NEAT
    Want to back the book? Here's a quick guide to rewards! And to help, the highlighted item on each level indicates the additional reward from the previous level! 
  In addition to the book, higher reward tiers will also be receiving awesome items such as...
Planning on backing at THE FULL TARZAN level, and have your eye on a specific "Anatomy of Animals" strip? Check the availability on this chart. It'll be first-come-gets-first-pick, based on when you pledge the Kickstarter!
  FINAL STRETCH GOALS!
We've blown through our Kickstarter goal, and four stretch goals! Adding super cool features to your book, at no additional cost to you! Check out below for our FINAL STRETCH GOALS! 
For the COLORING PAGES, here are the files to grab... 
TURTLE:
Flattened PDF (Good if coloring with crayons/pencils/markers) https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/10361859/COLORING_turtle.pdf Layered TIF (Good if coloring in Photoshop, etc) https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/10361859/COLORING_turtle.tif KOMODO DRAGON:
Flattened PDF (Good if coloring with crayons/pencils/markers) https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/10361859/COLORING_komodo.pdf
Layered TIF (Good if coloring in Photoshop, etc) https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/10361859/COLORING_komodo.tif
- Snag the file
- Color!
- Email me your submission at dave@davekellett.com!
We're hoping to ship your book out by the first week in December, using USPS. And, because we'll be shipping direct from the studio, each package will be getting a little smooch on its way out the door. EXTRA SMOOCHES FOR YOU, BASICALLY.
-----
(International Friends! We're charging *exactly what it costs us* to ship. So if you live in London or Sydney or Berlin, the shipping, alas, is what it is. But to help, we made a handy-dandy international shipping chart, which may help you decide on the biggest "bang for your buck" on shipping costs.)
Dave Kellett is the cartoonist behind the webcomics SHELDON and DRIVE, and co-Director on the comics documentary, STRIPPED. He's won the Silver Reuben Award for his comics, and twice been nominated for "Best Humor" for the Eisner Award. He's currently 5'8" tall.
LINKS: Sheldon | Drive | Stripped | Twitter | Instagram | Facebook
  Directed by: Fred Schroeder
Edited by: Ben Waters
Music: "Man About Town", "Ivy League Sweater", & "Curtain Call" all by Albert Marlowe. Licensed through Audioblocks. Also one tiny Easter Egg for close listeners. :)
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I've run three successful Kickstarters in the past, all of which delivered fun projects to backers. 

Since this is is my 4th Kickstarter, and my 14th book overall, I'm feeling confident about this project. But I do know that *unexpected hiccups* can pop up along the way, in production and in fulfillment. Should any problems or delays arise with the Anatomy of Animals book, backers can expect to be kept well-informed with regular updates until the problem is fixed.

============

THE BOOK ITSELF is being produced at one of the best book printers in the world, so the quality should be really nice. And because I want this book to be perfect, I'm going to be watchin' production like a hawk: A nervous, nervous, anxiety-prone hawk.

ADDITIONAL BACKER REWARDS are all being produced by vendors I’ve worked with before, and I’ve been very happy with the quality of their work.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
"CLASSICS (kind of)" - Silly New Versions of Cool Old Stories!  
Adapted and illustrated by Jason L. Witter
Hello all!  We have passed 10 stretch goals with 1 day to go! To celebrate this, in addition to everything else, I will be adding some extra goodies from the Witterworks collection (this could be extra buttons, postcard prints, magnets, etc.) to everyone who pledges $15 or more! THANK YOU ALL SO MUCH!!!
The Odyssey, Moby Dick, Dracula, Hamlet and The Raven as you've never seen them before!!!
Remember all those crusty, old books you had to read for high school English class?  Or maybe you're currently reading those crusty, old books for some crusty, old teacher in your crusty, old English class.  Don't wanna read them?  Problem solved!  Read "CLASSICS (kind of)" instead!  Disclaimer: I can't guarantee these will help you pass that crusty, old class with that crusty, old teacher (Note: I'm a teacher myself, so I'm pretty sure it's okay for me to poke fun at teachers).
Okay, here's the deal: I've adapted 5 of my favorite crusty, old stories into short, illustrated books that will be informative (kind of) and fun (yes!) for all ages!  
While remaining faithful (kind of) to the original stories, I have condensed them into short, comedic adaptations that will be a great introduction for new readers, but also an entertaining time for folks who love the original crusty, old books!  I actually do enjoy those crusty, old books.  But I really enjoy poking fun at them as well! 
These non-crusty, new paperback books measure 6"x6" and range from 50 to 72 pages.  Each one features a short adaptation of the classic with original black and white illustrations as well as other poems, drawings, puzzles and more!  
I plan on creating several sets of "CLASSICS (kind of)."  My ultimate goal is to turn this project into an ongoing series.  The crusty, old books I've chosen for the 1st set are: The Odyssey, Moby Dick, Hamlet, Dracula and The Raven.  
The "CLASSICS (kind of)" series will be a terrific way to introduce these stories to first time readers, and a hilarious addition to the collection for all you literary scholars out there!
Here are some sample pages from each book:
"Dracula" by Bram Stoker (kind of)
   The Odyssey by Homer (kind of)
  The Raven by Edgar Allan Poe (kind of)
  "Moby Dick" by Herman Melville (kind of)
  "Hamlet" by William Shakespeare (kind of)
AND EACH BOOK WILL INCLUDE ORIGINAL PUZZLES & GAMES!!! (if we reach our 1st stretch goal, I'll also add an original crossword puzzle to each book - WE REACHED IT)!!!
Word Searches, Mazes & More!!!
          6 Stretch Goals Reached!
    8 Stretch Goals Reached!!!
  NOTE: I apologize for not offering this campaign internationally. Shipping costs have just increased too much to make it economically feasible to ship these books to international addresses.  I truly apologize for this!  Please note that the PDF tier is available to international pledgers.  Thank you for understanding!

After that, I do not foresee any risks or challenges in getting them printed, shipped and in your hands by December 2017! Thank you for your generosity and support!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
