campaign.story:
Canvas Postcards inspired by the architecture of New Orleans
A. Navy Ikat B. Green Croton C. Pond D. Mosquito Polka Dot
All pillow cases are made by the women of Hagar's House in New Orleans.
Four pillow case design options to choose from.
Choose from our four New Orleans based designs for your chiffon scarf.
Table cloth and napkin set with an original Blissett design.
Choose from our four designs for your table cloth and napkin set.
WHAT DO WE DO?
Blissett Textile is a New Orleans-based company which provides customized digital printing services (blissetttextile.com). At Blissett Textile customers can design and print their own fabric for home furnishings, apparel and craft projects. Traditional textile manufacturing which includes apparel, home furnishings and upholstery requires large bulk orders and long lead times. With the innovation of digital printing, independent designers and small retailers can have access to high quality textiles on demand. Digital printing is also better for the environment because it wastes less water, ink and fabric than traditional textile manufacturing. Blissett Textile prints on natural fabrics and uses environmentally-friendly water-based inks. Like much of the South, New Orleans has a long and rich history in textile manufacturing. Before outsourcing to China became popular, New Orleans was home to textile manufacturers like Blumenthal Print Works and apparel brands such as Wrangler and Lee jeans.The last few remaining companies left after Hurricane Katrina (read more). Blissett Textile is proud to be part of the growing post-Katrina entrepreneurial culture that is helping to recreate textile manufacturing in New Orleans.
WHO ARE WE? 
Blissett Textile is led by a group of women who are passionate about design and committed to creating a sustainable model for environmentally-friendly textile manufacturing in New Orleans. Camilla Franklin is owner and chief designer for Blissett Textile. She has over 30 years of experience in textile design and manufacturing.Camilla loves the challenge of combining the originality of design with the advanced technology of digital printing. Jeanne Marquez is studio manager and designer. She is a native of New Orleans who returned after Hurricane Katrina to conduct surveys to preserve the unique architecture of New Orleans. Jeanne is inspired by color, light, pattern and all things New Orleans.  Katie Lerin Murphy is marketing manager and textile designer. Katie believes design works best when it’s a part of our social and environmental fabric.
WHY WE DO IT? 
In order to create a sustainable model for domestic manufacturing, New Orleans-based companies need a dedicated pool of skilled workers. With the loss of textile jobs to overseas markets, there has been a lack of workforce development and training in this industry for decades.As a woman-owned company firmly rooted in the community, Blissett Textile decided to partner with local non-profits to train and employ low-skilled workers in textile manufacturing. Last year, we launched our first workforce training program with Hagar's House.Hagar's House is a sanctuary for women and children in New Orleans that provides temporary housing for families affected by domestic violence, substance abuse or homelessness. (www.hagarhousenola.org).In the first year of our partnership we trained a number of women to design and sew pillows using customized fabric from Blissett Textile.These pillows were sold at local boutiques and provided income to help residents transition to more stable housing.
HOW CAN YOU HELP? 
Given our early success, we want to train and employ more women through Hagar's House, but we need to expand our manufacturing capacity. We need $10,000 to purchase more sewing machines, finishing equipment and technology upgrades for our website to add online and fulfillment capacity for the products made by Hagar's House residents.
WHAT IMPACT YOU WILL YOU HAVE? 
(1) New equipment to expand the manufacturing capacity of Blissett Textile, a New Orleans-based textile manufacturing company 
(2) Scale-up our workforce development program so that more women are trained to design and sew table linens, pillows and other products that will grow their personal income 
(3) Support the return of textile manufacturing to New Orleans by creating a ripple effect of more skilled workers to support the local industry
HOW WILL WE SHOW OUR THANKS? 
Each supporter of our Kickstarter campaign will receive a special edition textile product handmade by a Hagar's House resident. Here is a list of all the available rewards: REMEMBER Kickstarter funding is ALL OR NOTHING, so every contribution counts no matter how big or small!!! Our team thanks you for making textile manufacturing sustainable in New Orleans and helping us empower and employ local women through Hagar's House!!!!

campaign.story:
Mmmm, so much lampy goodness
Follow me on Instagram @lukelampcompany for more updates and scroll on down for the full Baselamp story : )
 (This is how we won't be delivering your Baselamps.) )
A sweet whiskey lamp for those Kickstarter-stress filled nights
The super cool Oregon Pint glass by North Drinkware
This is the only plant I've been able to keep alive in my apartment
This was so I can write off a new quadcopter as a business expense
Ain't nothin more pineappley than a pineapple soda lamp
Meet Baselamp – an effortless way to turn almost anything into a lamp.
Whether it's your favorite bottle of whiskey, a glass incense burner, a vintage notebook, a flower-filled vase, a particularly imposing action figure, or even your amazing quadcopter (while you wait for the batteries to charge) – the uses for Baselamp are endless, and limited only by your imagination.
 
I can't do yoga like that
That sandwich needs more bacon
Baselamp was designed and refined over the past year and a half with a focus on versatility and ease of use – with an integral chip-on-board LED and a recessed touch-capacitive dimmer switch, we've created a lamp that is not only super bright (410 lumens!) but also doesn't create too much heat or any UV light (a particular concern for the aforementioned whiskey application). 
The real beauty of Baselamp lies in the details. With countless prototypes and more redesigns than I can remember, we have truly refined every aspect. Here are some technical details, but feel free to message us with any questions and we'll do our best to promptly respond.
a solid walnut or bamboo body CNC machined in NY
total dimensions: 6.5" by 4" by 1" tall
a natural linseed oil hand-applied finish
a solid aluminum heatsink base extruded in New Hampshire
a 4 watt chip-on-board LG LED providing 410 lumens at 80 CRI
a Makrolon Lumen XT polycarbonate diffuser
a touch-capacitive aluminum dimmer switch to easily adjust brightness
a plug-in power adapter that will work on all voltages around the world
I can assure you that we are very prepared to see this project through to completion – I'm the guy behind Luke Lamp Co. and I've been designing and building lights for clients ranging from interior designers and restaurant owners all over the world to commercial clients as big as Twitter and Urban Outfitters. I've also been fortunate enough be featured on some pretty sweet websites:
We're so excited to bring Baselamp to life and we truly appreciate all of your support – every single pledge will help us to meet our goal, and if we can raise enough funds we'll be able to meet our manufacturing minimums and start ordering the parts we need to start production.
So now it's up to you, loyal Kickstarters. Without you, none of this would be possible – every person you tell about Baselamp, every Facebook mention and tweet and Instagram shout out and Pinterest pin and Tinder connection and Tumblr gif and Reddit front page post will give us the support we need to make this happen. And just to make things even easier, here's a super simple Google drive link to all the photos, videos, and .gifs you'll need to spread the word!
And, thanks to our talented in-house computer expert, we even have a technical CAD drawing that's already in the hands of our CNC fabricator (who is eagerly awaiting our final word to begin production):
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
While we have diligently prepared every step of the way with Baselamp, launching a real life product into the world comes with its fair share of challenges. 

To make sure everything goes as smoothly as possible we have already lined up suppliers and back-up suppliers for all of the components needed, as well as sourcing local manufacturers to help with the CNC fabrication of the solid wood body, and we have a ton of people ready and willing to help us build and fulfill every order. We also have more than four years of experience working with customers all over the world, so this isn't our first rodeo : )

As soon as this project reaches its funding goal we will start bringing in the parts and prepping our assembly line – we promise to keep you updated every step of the way and do everything we can to meet our deadlines.

campaign.story:
Lost your keys? Lost your job? Look at the bright side. At least you’re not plagued by pterodactyls, pursued by giant robots, or pestered by zombie poodles. Life is good!
The Things-Could-Be-Worse Mug is designed to remind you how lucky you are.
These porcelain mugs feature my drawing of a traditional blue-willow paradise discombobulated by more than a dozen calamities, perils, and pests. You’ll find...
• hairy fiend
• giant frog
• pirates
• cephalopod
• unpleasant blob creature
• voracious sea monster
• UFOs
• agressive pterodactyls
• rambunctious robots
• zombie poodle
and other suspicious animals and shrubs.
Some of life’s inconveniences glimpsed.
What do you get? Sponsors of this Kickstarter project will receive sets of four identical mugs decorated with my multi-calamity drawing. These mugs are made and decorated by the award-winning Kristoff Porcelain workshop in Poland using the traditional in-glaze technique. The mugs are food safe, microwave safe, and dishwasher safe so you can use them every day to remind you of all the problems you don’t have.
Reward: Set of four matching porcelain mugs
The Things-Could-Be-Worse Mug is NOT like those cheap ceramic mugs you get free from the auto body shop or the veterinarian. This is fine porcelain that will enhance your dinner table today and could also delight your descendants for generations.
Why sets of four? When you see how fine these mugs are, you’re going to be glad you have multiples for all your guests. If you are a lone wolf who survives with only one mug in your kitchen, you’ll have three beautiful mugs to give as gifts. Experts have assured me this is the way that classy dinnerware is packaged. Besides, I don’t have the resources to pack and ship mugs in different quantities. Keeping track of all that would make my head explode. Trust me—you’re going to be glad you have multiples.
Don evaluating mugs. These 12-ounce mugs are the perfect size.
I worked hard to find the perfect mug size and shape. I wanted to avoid the discomfort of gargantuan mugs that are too big to lift and tiny mugs that require constant refills. Unlike bland, ubiquitous cylindrical mugs, this mug’s gently curved shape enhances your meals with a sensuous form that suggests plump bounty and refined social grace. Caution: This high level of refinement may drive you to upgrade to a better quality coffee or tea. 
Coffee break
Things-Could-Be-Worse Mugs make perfect gifts. So, consider getting extras—especially for your coffee-loving friends.
Each peril is a vivid reminder that, even on your worst day, things could be much worse.
Your Things-Could-Be-Worse Mugs are sure to become treasured family heirlooms cherished for their beauty, utility, and humor. Plus, these mugs help you achieve inner peace by keeping life’s setbacks in perspective and promoting a healthy attitude of gratitude. Things could be worse.
My initial deign is flat. Then, I work out placement of all elements with cut paper on a blank mug to make sure one or more perils are always visible.
When will you receive your mugs? I’ve already completed this mug design and inspected the first prototypes. A second prototype is needed to confirm a tweak that was needed to refine the UFOs. Production can start as soon as I have enough pledges. Assuming nothing calamitous happens, you should be enjoying your favorite beverage in an amazing mug by early November 2015. Probably sooner.
International shipping. Mugs can ship anywhere in the world. Orders outside the US have a postage charge that varies depending on where the package is going. Porcelain is heavy, so postage costs are shockingly high. But for a treasured heirloom that may last generations, you might be able to justify the expense.
In some countries, customs duties may be applied to reward shipments. I have no way of predicting if they’ll apply to your parcel. It’s all very willy-nilly. They may not hit you, but don’t be surprised if the customs inspector arbitrarily singles you out. Things could be worse, right?
What’s going on? Sponsors of this project will receive periodic updates through Kickstarter as the project unfolds. You can also receive a trickle of news about all my silly projects by liking the Calamityware Facebook page.
Questions? Send me your questions and I’ll add them and the answers to the FAQ section at the bottom of this page.
If you are curious about production, you can study this overview of the steps involved to produce Calamityware plates. Production of porcelain mugs follows the same outline. (Too small? Click image to download PDF.)
Steps to get fine porcelain to your door.
Want to see more of Don's drawings? Each day, I try to post a fresh drawing from my sketchbook on Flickr. Feel free to follow along if you are interested in what I’m working on. 
Don
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Countless things could go wrong to delay this project. But the design is done and the pre-production proof has been approved. So if I get enough sponsors, I can green-light production without delay. I’m using a workshop that produces porcelain for monarchs and potentates and has perfected production techniques over 180 years. So technical problems are unlikely. The biggest risk is that production will take longer than anticipated—perhaps because a potentate gets into the production queue ahead of us.

I promise that I won’t stop working until all my sponsors receive their things-could-be-worse mugs. I think we’ll be shipping by early
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There are always risks and challenges whenever creating a new product like the Silk Light. From a hardware standpoint, the Silk Light shares a lot of similarities with previous LED bulbs, with the addition of a second bank of LEDS for color temperature flexibility. We are using a very reliable Zigbee SOC (System On Chip) and have a lot of experience working with this SOC already. 

Our greatest challenge is getting the firmware out of beta stage and ready for primetime. In addition to the firmware development, making it play nicely with the smartphone apps also represents a challenge. The level of scheduling control and the nClick functionality has never been done before in a smart bulb, mostly because of how complicated it makes the firmware design. We have beta firmware in place and working already, so we are confident in our ability to finalize the firmware and complete the app functionality.

We have a highly-experienced manufacturing partner lined up for production. This gives us great confidence in our ability to deliver a polished final product.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Drinking water is the simplest thing we can do to feel our best every day. But with daily distractions, millions of us don't take care of ourselves the way we should. We simply forget. That's why we built HidrateMe, a connected water bottle that tracks your water intake and makes sure that you're hydrated all day long.
 The HidrateMe bottle is a 24 oz. - 710 ml. reusable water bottle, made out of BPA free Tritan plastic. It's dishwasher safe and comes with a leak proof cap. The sensor stick inside the bottle automatically tracks how much you drink throughout the day. It sends information to the Hidrate app on your phone and glows when its time to drink more water. The battery is easily replaceable and sold in most stores, and it lasts over a year, so you never need to recharge it.
We carry our water bottles with us everywhere, that's why we designed a bottle that could transition from the office to the gym. It's a natural extension of yourself.
It's sleek, elegant, and smart. Surprise! There's a ripple design under the lid! We love the little things that makes you smile. The HidrateMe has a pour style mouth piece that's simple to use. 
PLAY

The Hidrate app is fun and easy to use. Here is a little demo video of the app and how the bottle works and syncs via Bluetooth. Plus it glows if you haven't had anything to drink for an extended period of time to remind you to stay hydrated.
PLAY

Our app is as friendly and playful as it is easy and effective to use. Oh and the best part, the app is completely FREE and works on iPhone and Android! The app will be available for download winter 2015.
Designed with you in mind, our app has a friendly and thoughtful user interface. Starting with your height, weight, age and activity level the app calculates just how much water you should be drinking throughout the day.
Its easy to see your progress towards your goals, and you also receive reminders if you fall off track. The app also integrates with your wearables to help tune your water goals even more accurately to your activities. Using your location, the app can adjust your daily water goal depending on the temperature, humidity, and elevation of your surroundings.
We unlocked our first stretch goal and asked everyone to vote on a new color. Here it is - PURPLE!
$600K STRETCH GOAL - Don't Leave Me Behind (App feature)
As promised, we're launching a NEW stretch goal for $600K. This one is going to be for a software feature: Don't Leave Me Behind. This feature makes sure that you will never lose your water bottle again. With this feature, you will get a reminder and location to where the bottle was last "seen" if you left your water bottle somewhere for an extended period of time.

WE RAISED 600K SO IT'S HAPPENING!
We're young entrepreneurs who are passionate about design, community, and the small things in life that help us all feel better. We all met at the University of Minnesota, in the start up capital of The North. Our team includes left to right: Alexander "Ham" Hambrock, Coleman Iverson, Nadya Nguyen, Daniel Worku, and Alexandra Feeken. We're a team of engineers, designers, marketers, and developers. 
In September 2014 our CEO Nadya pulled together a team of fellow University of Minnesota students for the Google Startup weekend in Minneapolis, Minnesota to build the first smart water bottle prototype. In just 54 hours we built a water bottle that tracked water intake and synced to a mobile app on a smartphone.
We won third place and people began asking when the water bottles would be available for purchase. That’s the moment we knew they were on to something. The team worked evenings and weekends for 7 months before being accepted into the Sprint Mobile Health Accelerator powered by Techstars. 
We quit our jobs and left everything behind to work on a product that we believed in. The program is a 3 month-long intensive on-site experience in Kansas City, MO in which 10 mobile-health companies selected from around the world receive funding and mentorship to accelerate their businesses.
We reiterated multiple bottle designs before deciding to go with the final Hidrate Me. The lid was another challenge in itself and we 3D printed and tested several before finalizing our design.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Manufacturing the Bottle
Many small companies face difficulties when it comes to manufacturing new products, from design problems to unexpected costs. That's why we've made it a priority from the very beginning to involve manufacturers every step of the way, catching issues before they had a chance to become problems. Members of our team have seen multiple products through from concept to manufacturing. 

Shipping in Winter 2015
We plan to place the manufacturing order by the end of June 2015. We'll be reviewing samples in August and September. December of 2015 / January 2016 is our shipping estimate when we account for both making revisions and getting the first shipment in from the factory.

Battery Life
Our testing shows that the included battery will power the Hidrate Me bottle for well over a year. We are still doing additional testing and tweaking to make sure that the battery life will be at least a year.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
The Unicorn Files: Debunking the Myth of the Female Geek aims to show that geeky women exist, are a diverse group, and an important part of the geek community. This Kickstarter will allow us to self-publish the project into a photo and story book.
The Project
For the past year, Terra Clarke Olsen (founder and art director) and Nate Watters (photographer) have been photographing women for "The Unicorn Files: Debunking the Myth of the Female Geek". The Unicorn Files aims to capture the diverse body of female geeks by featuring individual geeky women, giving women in the community a chance to tell their story. We aimed to capture a wide selection of women, from fans to people in the industry (such as Kelly Sue DeConnick and Angela Webber). The photos represent them and what they love. Every shot is unique (some women have a lot of geek memorabilia while others have none; some women are comic nerds while others are tech geeks), but the one common theme being that the photos are taken in their home (a safe space that is reflective of them). 
The Book 
The Unicorn Files photo book will include women's portraits, along with a bio and quote from each individual. Essays and short stories will also be included in the book to ensure a fuller picture of the female experience in the geek community. 
The physical book will be 9x11, 96 pages, and softcover. We are using a high quality printer and will be adding a matte finish to the cover. 
Why this project? 
Over the past few years, many people have written about females in the geek community, and how the group is often dismissed and overlooked. Although all this literature is important and valuable, we wanted to take it to the logical next step- to create an avenue that SHOWS women are in the geek community. Lady geeks exist; we’re an important part of the geek community, and we’re not going to disappear. 
Why a photo book? 
Originally we wanted to create a photo exhibit, but then we realized that these photos and women's stories should be shared with the rest of the community! So we've decided to launch a Kickstarter in the hopes that we can self-publish a photo book. 
 Where is the money going? 
We're committed to supporting local businesses so have decided to publish The Unicorn Files through a local printing company. Funds from this Kickstarter will pay for the printing of the physical book, as well as the buttons, stickers, shipping materials, and shipping costs. 
Big THANK YOU to the talented Tammy Vince Cruz of tbvc design for creating all the graphics and our logo!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Challenges include unforeseen issues with printing and paper costs.

If we photograph backers who's images are to appear in The Unicorn Files, there may be scheduling challenges that could delay the publishing date.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Hello Friends, 
This update has been a long time coming. My apologies for the delay in compiling our project into something you can take home. Long story short, I took a break from my extra projects once I gave birth to my child in Dec 2014. In addition to that, Nate's photography business became (and is) very busy. But huzzah, the wait is over! You can now purchase The Unicorn Files in magazine form. We hope you like it. <3

We’re in our final push, as this is our last week of fundraising! We’ve worked hard on this project and would love to see it become a reality. These women have unique experiences and stories, which we believe are an important part of geek culture that should be shared. If you believe in our mission and want to see these women and their stories in a book, please consider making a donation. Thank you!

campaign.story:
“The single story creates stereotypes, and the problem with stereotypes is not that they are untrue, but that they are incomplete. They make one story become the only story.”                                                                            ― Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie
In 2007, we were two high schoolers with an idea...
What seemed like an afternoon of mindlessly flipping through fashion magazines with our best friend, became much more. We were so disappointed by the lack of diversity within those pages that it sparked us to think of ways we could broaden the scope of representation.
Hanging out in the school library
A few weeks later, Elle & Cee World Girls was born.
Our dolls represent girls from different countries and backgrounds in order to help girls understand and celebrate diversity within themselves and others. Elle & Cee World Girls encourages girls to connect the global dots at an early age, so that they can create the tools they need to build a better world—together. We are Team World Girls!
We spent over a year creating and perfecting our prototype.
***
As Seen In:
Mic Identities, Bustle, Style Cartel, GOOD, Daily Mail, B* Real, Latina Magazine, MIMI
***
Each doll will have a unique face mold. We are working on creating a range of molds, so that our dolls reflect many phenotypes.
Meet Pemberly (USA/Innovator), our prototype doll: Made with love, soul, and lots of attention to detail
Zari was inspired by our Caribbean heritage (Guyana). Never having seen a mainstream doll that represented a girl from the Caribbean, we wanted to highlight this beautiful island, culture, and people.
Hallo! Our inspiration for Maud came from our semester of German in college with the best German Professor ever.
WHAT ARE THESE TRAITS?
Our dolls are inspired by amazing girls and women, and we thought it would be powerful to assign each doll 1 of 7 traits.  Not only do the traits allow for imagination and aspiration, they encourage girls to identify not only with the dolls' looks, but with her passions and interests.

Each doll comes:
Fully outfitted with an ECWG ambassador's sweater.
With a passport that tells you about the doll and her country in a fun way.
With a bracelet for our real world girl that correlates with the doll's trait.
How are we "Not Just a Doll"? What makes us different?
We see our dolls as an introduction to global awareness.  They will highlight girls from different countries and backgrounds and represent not one, but many stories.
Our dolls are a team.  We are in this together!
Our dolls have strong traits that will help girls connect to their dolls and people beyond their looks.
We want girls to grow with ECWG and be involved in building the global platform.  Their voices and stories are the heart of ECWG.
We need your help to:
Bring Zari & Maud to life (molds) and for manufacturing/production (lots of testing!, master molds, samples and packaging).
 Rewards
Original ECWG postcard by children's illustrator, Delphine Henault
Write in style!
Original postcard by 11 year old World Girl, Alyssa L.: Unlocking the World
PLAY

 World girls (poet included) recite "We Will" poem by 13 year old, Hillary D.
18x24" Poster: We Will by Hillary D., 13 and original artwork by children's illustrator, Doreen Mulryan
Get the whole team!
Each doll comes with a passport and a bracelet for our real world girl
 *Clothing will change during the production process. Skin tone, hair color/texture, and eye-color is also subject to change, but we will do our best to maintain the integrity of the original renderings and prototype.
Our dolls will go through rigorous testing to comply with American and European toy safety standards (ASTM & EN-71) for ages 6 and up.
At the end of our project, we will send you a survey so you can select your doll(s).
Caitie McCabe Photography
 Credits
ECWG Kickstarter Video by Tafadzwa Chiriga
Feature Photography by Caitie McCabe
Special thanks to: the Lower Eastside Girls Club
Olga at Sunil Hair
To our family, friends, supporters, allies, present and future World Girls, and everyone who made this possible, thank you. Let's do this!

We are working with our doll experts and manufacturers to ensure that we create a doll that we and our customers will be proud of. 

We will NOT deliver by the 2015 holiday season due to the amount of time it takes to make molds, master molds, and samples before production. This is a process that we will not rush or compromise in any way.

Our Kickstarter will serve as a soft launch. We want our supporters to have the first elle & cee world girls dolls ever to be produced! And by next holiday season, we will be in full swing and ready to rock this world.

campaign.story:
Say goodbye to boredom. You and your guests deserve more excitement. Nothing adds excitement like an active volcano and a river of burning lava. Imagine finishing your meal and finding this marvel behind your lasagna!
One man’s lava is another man’s comedy.
You can hang it on your wall or use your plates for meals (food safe, microwave safe, dishwasher safe). Makes a really astonishing gift, especially for volcanologists and relatives with anger-management problems.
Top quality. These plates will be produced at the award-winning Kristoff porcelain workshop in Poland using the in-glaze technique. Final production will feature a rich blue image on 10.5"-diameter, white porcelain that’s destined to become a treasured family heirloom.
Series 2. This rambunctious-volcano plate is the second in my in-glaze series. In-glaze plates are fired at extra high temperature to allow the image to melt slightly into the surface of the plate. Connoisseurs will appreciate the beauty of the in-glaze technique which the artists at Kristoff have been refining since 1831. This is the look of porcelain you see in museums. Sweet.
Previous Calamityware plates. If you missed the previous Kickstarter projects and want to address a gap in your Calamityware plate collection, you’ll find earlier plates from both Series 1 and Series 2 at Calamityware.com.
Some of the previous Calamityware plate designs.
Will all the plates in this series match? No. The designs of the plate borders and central image of each Calamityware plate are different. It’s also possible that the exact size of the plates and the shade of blue will shift slightly because the plates, transfers, and firing happen at different times and months apart. If you appreciate the notion of “eclectic,” you’ll be delighted. But if you are a perfectionist about matching, you should order enough of your favorite Calamityware plate so all your guests have the same design.
How can I get a collection of different designs? If you want each of your dinner guests to have a different calamity, the best way is to sponsor each of the successive Kickstarter projects. I’m trying to space these projects about 45 days apart. So, in 2015, it should be possible to introduce four new designs—pirates in the neighborhood, rambunctious volcano, tentacles!, and vortex of doom. You can find the first four Calamityware plate designs from Series 1 here.
When can I dine with volcanoes? I’ve already proofed this plate design, so production can start as soon as I have enough sponsors. Assuming nothing calamitous happens, you should be dining with this spirited volcano by the end of July 2015. Maybe sooner.
International shipping. Plates can ship anywhere in the world. Orders outside the US have a postage charge that varies depending on where the package is going. Porcelain plates are heavy, so postage costs are shockingly high. But for a treasured heirloom that may last generations, you might be able to justify the expense.
In some countries, customs duties may be applied to plate shipments. I have no way of predicting if they’ll apply to your shipment. It’s all very willy-nilly.
What’s going on? Sponsors of this project will receive periodic updates through Kickstarter as the project unfolds. You can also receive a trickle of news about designing, producing, and enjoying Calamityware plates by liking the Calamityware Facebook page.
Questions? Send me your questions and I’ll add them and the answers to the FAQ section of this page.
If you are curious about production, you can study this overview of the steps involved. (Too small? Click image to download PDF.)
Want to see more of Don’s drawings? I post a new drawing of something almost every day on Flickr. You can see my preliminary Calamityware sketches and drawings in this Flickr album.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Countless things could go wrong to delay this project. But the design is done and the pre-production proof has been approved. So if I get enough sponsors, I can green-light production. I’m using a workshop that produces porcelain for monarchs and potentates and has perfected production techniques over 180 years. So technical problems are unlikely. The biggest risk is that production will take longer than anticipated. 

I promise that I won’t stop working until all my sponsors receive their Calamityware plates. I think we’ll be shipping before the end of July 2015. I hope it can be sooner.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Calamityware: I hope you meant it
updates.update_content:
Many sponsors assured me they’d support additional Calamityware plate designs if I created more. I hope someone meant it. 
I launched a new Kickstarter project today. The seventh Calamityware dinner plate features a giant octopus.

Good news. Shipments of Calamityware dinner plate 6: rambunctious volcano, started going out today. Almost all shipments will be rolling by the end of the day tomorrow. So you can enjoy a good hot meal soon. Nothing warms up left overs better than a river of burning lava.

Shipping is about to begin. Log on to Kickstarter and confirm your shipping address, if you haven’t already. The Calamityware volcano plates are expected to reach Fulfillrite next week and we want to have all the shipping labels ready to go.
Speaking of ready to go, my new Kickstarter project launched today.

The Calamityware plate 6: Rambunctious volcano project closed last night. It was a success. Thanks!
As I said in my previous update, because your initial support for this project was so strong, I authorized production to start early. So the volcano plates already caught their boat. We are absolutely going to ship in July. Next week, you can expect a Kickstarter survey to allow you to confirm your address. Start thinking about what meal or snack you’ll choose to initiate your Calamityware 6 plate.

campaign.story:
I like drawings that make me laugh. When I inherited a traditional Willow-pattern plate, I just had to redraw it and add a pterodactyl. As I drew more plates and added more calamities—UFOs, Sasquatch, and volcanoes—folks urged me to produce real dinner plates. A Kickstarter project was born.
My first four Calamityware Kickstarter projects (flying monkey, giant robot, voracious sea monster, and UFO invasion) found sponsors, so here is the fifth project in what might turn out to be a long series. 
This design includes robust ornaments, a rich assortment of flora and fauna, architectural marvels, innocent victims, romance, and enterprising pirates. Imagine all those curiosities behind your Chicken Kiev!
Prototype details
Final production will feature a rich blue image on 10.5"-diameter, white porcelain plates. You can hang it on your wall or use it for dinner (food safe, microwave safe, dishwasher safe). Makes a really astonishing gift, especially for pirates.
Series continues. I’m committed to producing at least eight plate designs. If sponsors remain enthusiastic, I’ll go to 12.
Here’s the current lineup. 
SERIES 1: On-Glaze Plates
Calamityware Plate 1: flying monkeys 
Calamityware Plate 2: giant robot 
Calamityware Plate 3: voracious sea monster 
Calamityware Plate 4: UFO invasion
SERIES 2: In-Glaze Plates
Calamityware Plate 5: pirates in the neighborhood
Calamityware Plate 6: rambunctious volcano
Calamityware Plate 7: tentacles!
Calamityware Plate 8: vortex of doom
Previous Calamityware plates
If you missed the previous Kickstarter projects and want to address a gap in your Calamityware plate collection, you’ll find earlier plates at BuyCalamityware.com
This plate (and future Calamityware plates) are going to be produced at the award-winning Kristoff porcelain workshop in Poland. This change will allow me to shift from on-glaze to in-glaze production. As good as the original plates were, these new plates will be slightly better.
What’s the difference? My designs of the first four Calamityware plates were applied on top of the final porcelain glaze. You can actually feel the vitreous inks standing proud on the surface. But with the in-glaze technique, the image will be more smoothly integrated into the surface of the plate. Casual observers won’t see a difference, but connoisseurs will appreciate the beauty of the in-glaze technique which the artists at Kristoff have been refining since 1831. This is the look of porcelain plates you see in museums. Sweet.
Series 2 Calamityware plates are a slightly deeper blue.
The Series 2 Calamityware plates are slightly more shallow in shape and the blue is just a touch more somber—a tiny bit less perky.
Will all the plates in this series match? No. The designs of the plate borders and central image of each Calamityware plate are different. It’s also possible that the exact size of the plates and the shade of blue will shift slightly because the plates, transfers, and firing happen at different times, months apart, on different continents. If you appreciate the notion of “eclectic,” you’ll be delighted. But if you are a perfectionist about matching, you should order enough of your favorite Calamityware plate so all your guests have the same design.
How can I get a collection of different designs? If you want each of your dinner guests to have a different calamity, the best way is to sponsor each of the successive Kickstarter projects. I’m trying to space these projects 30 days apart. So, in 2015, it should be possible to introduce the four new designs listed above. You can find the first four Calamityware plate designs here. 
When? I’ve already proofed this plate design, so production can start as soon as I have enough sponsors. Assuming nothing calamitous happens, you should be dining with pirates by the end of July 2015. Maybe sooner. 
International shipping. Plates can ship anywhere in the world. Orders outside the US have a postage charge that varies depending on where the package is going. Porcelain plates are heavy, so postage costs are shockingly high. But for a treasured heirloom that may last generations, you might be able to justify the expense.
In some countries, customs duties may be applied to plate shipments. I have no way of predicting if they’ll apply to your shipment. It’s all very willy-nilly.
What’s going on? Sponsors of this project will receive periodic updates through Kickstarter as the project unfolds. You can also receive a trickle of news about designing, producing, and enjoying Calamityware plates by liking the Calamityware Facebook page.
Questions? Send me your questions and I’ll add them and the answers to the FAQ section of this page.
Want to see more of Don’s drawings? I post a new drawing of something almost every day on Flickr. You can see my preliminary Calamityware sketches and drawings in this Flickr album.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Countless things could go wrong to delay this project. But the design is done and the pre-production proof has been approved. So if I get enough sponsors, I can green light production. I’m using a workshop that produces porcelain for monarchs and potentates and has perfected production techniques over 180 years. The biggest risk is that production will take longer than anticipated. 

We must mold blank plates and produce transfers. Then skilled decorators must apply the transfers to the center, rim, and back of two thousand plates by hand. All the plates need to be glazed and fired multiple times. Finally the plates will be packed into a container and loaded on a ship. The captain must cross the Atlantic while avoiding icebergs and pirates. In Baltimore, the ship will be unloaded and the plates trucked to the fulfillment center in New Jersey.

I think I’ve left ample time for all these steps in the schedule, but lots of problems could arise.

I’m now working with Fulfillrite, so the shipping problems that haunted the first series of Calamityware projects are gone.

Fate could still fling new and unexpected problems at me. Earthquakes could toss cities, UFOs invade, or pirates sink my boat, so I’m alert for pending disasters. I promise that I won’t stop working until all my sponsors receive their Calamityware plates. I think we’ll be shipping before the end of July 2015. I hope it can be sooner.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Don

campaign.story:
MAGICALLY SEND PHOTOS INTO YOUR LOVED ONE'S HOME
Skylight is a beautiful touch-screen, Wi-Fi connected photo frame that lets you email photos from your phone or computer directly onto your loved one's Skylight - from anywhere in the world!
How It Works: Three Easy Steps
1. Connect your Skylight to a power source and it automatically powers up
2. Our simple touch-screen UI lets you connect to Wi-Fi in <60 seconds
3. Send pictures to your Skylight's dedicated email address, and they arrive in <60 seconds
Skylight's Features: Designed To Delight
Effortless set up. Skylight sets up out of the box in 1-2 minutes. It automatically detects available wi-fi networks, and the touch screen lets you connect to one easily.
Just email photos to Skylight. Each Skylight has a dedicated email address, and you can send it photos in batches as email attachments from your phone or computer.
Touch screen functionality. Our touch screen UI makes it effortless to swipe through photos, delete photos, and freeze the frame on a favorite photo.
Everyone in the family can send to one Skylight. For example, Grandma could get photos from all her grandkids.
You can send photos to multiple Skylights at once. For example, if you give a Skylight to Mom and Grandma, you can send photos at the same time to both devices.
New photos notification. A clear notification makes it really easy for the Skylight owner to see when new photos have arrived. They can tap the notification to see the new photos.
"Heart" button to thank the sender. If your loved one wants to tell you they really liked a certain photo, they can just tap the heart button and Skylight sends an email to you letting you know.
Automatically get new future features. Skylight software will improve over time, and every time we add something cool like video or text-on-photo, you'll get that feature too.
A great gift for loved ones
Treasured photos used to have a special place in our homes. But these days, with all the photos we share over Facebook, WhatsApp, Instagram, etc, the really special family photos get lost in the fray.
Digital frames tried to solve this, but have always come up short. They're complicated to use, and what's worse, no one ever updates them since they require a USB or memory card to add photos. The photos you want to share are on your phone or laptop, not a USB.
We wanted to create an affordable, beautiful device that would make it effortless for us to surprise our loved ones with photos. Enter Skylight: it sets up effortlessly, lets you send photos from phone or computer in seconds, and photos arrive in <60 seconds.
Product Specs
Plug & Play: Skylight is perfect for parents and grandparents who just want a frame that works without any hassle. After you turn it on, it automatically detects available wi-fi networks, and the touch screen makes it easy to connect to the one of your choice. From there, Skylight will display any photos you send to it in a chronological slideshow.
As soon as photos are added to Skylight, they are automatically resized to fit in the 7-inch high quality display. The LED screen will present your best shots in a 1.7:1 aspect ratio and photos will be rotated to their proper orientation automatically.
Specifications:
Display size: 7-inches (17.8 cm) 
Display type/backlight: LED
Display resolution: 1024x600
Aspect ratio: 1.7:1
Image file format: JPEG, JPG, BMP, PNG, GIF
Transition Time: 8 seconds
Time from E-mail to Frame: <60 seconds
Package Contents:
Skylight Digital Photo Frame & attached power cord
Getting Started Guide
Our Story & Timeline
It's been an incredibly rewarding journey for our team. We met as graduate students at Harvard, and had a simple wish: to create a new way to share photos with our loved ones. Many months later, we've turned that idea into a product! Along the way, we built dozens of prototypes in our dorm rooms, had hundreds of customer conversations, and poured our hearts into this project. Now we are ready to take it to the next level, and need your help to start large-scale manufacturing and share Skylight with the world!
Our friends who tried the alpha units liked them, and gave us great feedback. After we upgraded the hardware and software experience, our beta testers absolutely loved the new product! Here are some testimonials from our earliest testers:
I am actually so excited for Skylight - what an incredibly cool product! My whole family lives outside of the US so I've never been able to share things with them as much as I've wanted- and now I'm really excited to.
- Michelle Cho
Skylight is literally the most exciting present idea I have seen so far!!! So great, in fact, that I volunteered to spread the word. This phone-to-frame idea makes it amazingly convenient for our generation to help our parents/ grandparents/ people far from us stay engaged in our lives. My dad is definitely going to think there is magic involved...!
- Nara Lee
I love Skylight. It makes sharing pictures so easy with my family. With 20 grandchildren across 4 states, it helps my parents share and celebrate some of the best moments in the lives of their grandchildren.
- Jaren Nichols
 Now it's your turn to experience Skylight! 
Thank you!
Thanks to our friends and family for supporting us through this project, to Professors Joseph Fuller and Tom Nicholas for providing invaluable advice, to our videographer Evan Carter for doing such a great job, and especially to the Rock Center for Entrepreneurship and the Harvard Innovation Lab for giving us the support and space to launch this company!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As in every hardware product, many disciplines need to come together: hardware design, software development, manufacturing and supply chain. After extensive testing with real customers in a private beta we feel very confident that we have a great product. However, the main risk for our project is that for the time being we rely on two manufacturers, and this impacts our ability to mitigate production and shipment delays. 

After having a successful campaign, we will be able to diversify our suppliers and hold inventory to make sure we can commit to quick, accurate delivery dates.

With YOUR help we will be able to grow up as a company and have in place the supply chain logistics to deliver a flawless customer experience. THANK YOU!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Thanks to everyone for making this campaign a huge success! Stay connected on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram for news and updates. Sign up at northdrinkware.com  to be notified when The Oregon Pint and future glasses are available to order.  
Welcome to North Drinkware and the launch of our first product, The Oregon Pint. The Oregon Pint is an American-made, custom blown 16 oz. glass that has Mt. Hood - Oregon’s highest peak at 11,250 feet - molded into the base. 
We made The Oregon Pint because we wanted a glass with a connection to the places where we live and play. We were seeking a glass that was crafted with the same skill, care and consideration as the beer we love to drink. The Oregon Pint delivers an enhanced experience when enjoying a beer and swapping stories after a ride, a day on the hill, or when gathering with friends and family. 
Using United States Geological Survey (USGS) data (depicting ridges, canyons, and peak) a 3D model of Mt. Hood is integrated into the mold so your beer cascades around the mountain when you pour it into the glass. The Oregon Pint delivers a connection to the mountains that surround us, and the satisfying experience of drinking a local crafted beer out of a local crafted glass - all made here in Oregon.
We love Oregon. We are fortunate this state produces many quality beverages -- water, wine, cider and, of course, beer. The beer scene in Oregon is amazing. Over 180 brewing companies operate over 225 brewing facilities in 71 cities around the state. Portland has the most breweries of any city in the world and Portland leads the US for the percentage of dollars spent on craft beer. 
We look forward to providing a premium product for an industry we personally support and one that thrives within our state. As we grow, we plan to offer glasses with a signature landmark in other states including, Washington, Vermont, California and Colorado.
In making The Oregon Pint, we've combined modern technology with the old world craft of blowing glass to make a beautiful and relevant new product. With our design concept in place we took USGS topographical data of Mt. Hood and converted it to a digital 3D model. We then made 3D prints of our designs for design evaluation and prototyping. Once we were satisfied with our design, we created molds for our first blown glass prototypes. With our design finalized, we've ordered our first production mold and are almost ready to start production.    
3D Prints in the garage to make prototype molds.
Blowing the bubble into the glass.
Forming the shape.
 Dropping the bubble into a plaster prototype mold.
Flame polishing the lip.
Blowing glass is a challenging and time-consuming process, requiring specialized equipment and a high level of skill. Thankfully, we have a great partner, Elements Glass, a world-class glass blowing studio based here in Portland. Throughout the prototyping and development process we worked closely with their team of experts and will continue to do so as we move forward.
We've taken The Oregon Pint through multiple rounds of prototypes, refining our design and glass blowing technique. We have ordered our production tooling and with your support we will be able to ramp up production.
In addition to our glasses we are offering a Kickstarter exclusive Mt. Hood Coaster. The ten-ply birch coasters are first cut using a CNC machine and then laser etched with USGS topographic data of Mt.Hood. Kickstarter Edition and Made in Oregon details. These coasters and handmade in Portland, OR, by our good friends at Shwood. 
North Drinkware and MadeHere PDX are forging a unique partnership to support The Oregon Pint on Kickstarter.  At MadeHere PDX, the new store located on NW 10th and Couch in Portland, OR we have developed a Live on Kickstarter in-store display.  During the campaign you can visit the design shop to see a prototype glass and talk with the knowledgable staff about North Drinkware and The Oregon Pint.
 When supporting The Oregon Pint with any dollar amount, you are funding:
Our vision. After The Oregon Pint we plan to roll out glasses to other regions with a strong craft beer scene;
Buying the expensive tooling and other necessary materials for glass production;
Our first big run of glasses with the team at Elements Glass; and,
Support to develop a strategy for large scale quality control, packaging, shipping and order management.
North Drinkware is a team of three friends that together have over 30 years of experience in product design, engineering and marketing who live and work in Portland, Oregon. We all explore the mountains, coast, trails and rivers as much as possible. Originally, we came from the East Coast (Matt & Leigh) and from NorCal (Nic), but Oregon has become our home over the last decade.
We bring expertise in design, development, production, marketing and communications, and look forward to leveraging all of our skills for North Drinkware. After many moves early in our careers we have started our families and built our communities within Oregon. 
Thank you for your support, and for sharing our project with your friends and family.  
Please contact us with any questions at info@northdrinkware.com
Follow us to stay connected with North!
Facebook        Instagram       Twitter
Special thanks to Dustin Ortiz  and Stone Crandall for the amazing product photography and Robinson Kuntz for the custom music track in our video.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As with any product manufacturing project, there can be unforeseen risks. Making products can encounter unplanned obstacles along the way, such as manufacturing processes and quality issues. Our team has selected excellent partners and works hands-on to ensure an efficient and accurate manufacturing process, and we stand behind our products 100%. We will not ship 2nd rate glasses to our supporters. If a glass arrives damaged, please let us know within 7 days with detailed photos and we will send you a replacement glass.


As of the launch of this Kickstarter campaign we have prototyped many glasses in plaster molds and have ordered our production tooling. Several rounds of development have refined our production quality so that we will be ready to fulfill perks. We have designed and ordered our packing and shipping materials. Our marketing and communication plan is in place and being rolled out with this Kickstarter launch.

We thank you in advance for your support so we can start making large runs of glasses and all enjoy a craft beer out of The Oregon Pint glass.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Thank you North backers for your ongoing support of The Oregon Pint! The team at Elements Glass and North continue to work around the clock making glasses to fulfill perks as quickly as possible. To date we have delivered over 9,000 Oregon Pint glasses to backers which successfully completes shipments to all June backers (besides the few whose addresses we still need!), and local pick up at MadeHere PDX for both June and September backers. We are now beginning shipments for September backers.
We continue to have many learnings as The Oregon Pint is produced at production scale. Most of these learnings help us further refine our process and begin planning and design for glasses in other states and mountains for late fall/holiday 2015. That said, we’ve had a few tooling hiccups which have set us back due to timelines when ordering new molds. We’re disappointed that we will not ship all September backers by the end of the month, but thank you in advance for your patience! Glasses will be shipped in backer order throughout September and October. You will get an email from UPS with tracking information when your glass is on its way.

Just seven weeks after closing our Kickstarter campaign we began shipping our first backers! Over the course of 15 weeks we’ll have shipped over 7000 glasses to 27 countries around the world. We fell a few weeks behind due to some production hiccups but overall we’re very pleased that we’re just a few weeks away from completing June shipments. Yahoo! Thanks to everyone for your support and patience. Next up, September backers!
We’ll be closing the Kickstarter Survey for September Backers Friday, July 17. If you don’t fill out your survey we won’t be able to send you your glasses.

updates.update_userinfo: June and September Backer Shipment Update
updates.update_content:
Your Oregon Pint glasses are coming...so, so, soon! As we enter the second week of June, we wanted to give an update on our progress.
The team at North and Elements have been working around the clock to make as many production quality glasses as possible. At this point we have shipped over 4,500 glasses and over 1,000 glasses were picked up locally at MadeHere PDX. We have a team blowing and finishing glasses eight hours a day Monday - Friday, resulting in about 540 glasses a week. As we have shared, there are over 15 steps to making each individual Oregon Pint glass. We’re working to try and create efficiencies where possible, and learning a lot in the process. Unfortunately there have been a some production hiccups that have set us back a few weeks from our original targets. This means that some June backers will be receiving their glasses during the first few weeks of July. We’re shipping glasses chronologically in backer order. Once they ship,you will receive an email with a UPS tracking number, so you will know they are on their way.

campaign.story:
I love traditional bandanas, but they need a little extra pizzazz. My design for BADbandana 2 features a host of menacing creatures—robots, monkeys, space invaders, giant snails, and much more. The visual language of BADbandana 2 celebrates the pixels of early video games and the gracious stitches of folk-art embroidery in a design that perfectly balances the beautiful and the silly. Each time you look, you’ll discover another treat.
Don with a paper prototype.
I’m going to reproduce this drawing as a 21-inch square bandana. White creatures on a chili-pepper, fire-engine red background. These bandanas will be 100 percent cotton printed right here in the good-old USA. (Dyed, not that stiff, obnoxious silkscreening we all hate.)
What do you get? A total of more than 260 monsters and marvels. All combined into a serenely symmetrical composition that is an homage to the paisley-enriched bandanas of yesteryear.
A few of the monsters and marvels in BADbandana 2.
Bandanas have so many uses in fashion, personal hygiene, and piracy. No one is going to want just one. So I’m offering reward levels of BADbandanas in packs of three.
BADbandanas make superb gifts. So even if you aren’t a big fan of bandanas, you may want to get a bunch to share with your friends, family, and favorite cowboys.
Do you need a reminder of how you can use your BADbandanas? 
Just a few of the gazillion uses for a BADbandana modeled by Don and dog. (Don’s the one wearing glasses.)
WHAT ABOUT MORE CALAMITYWARE PLATES?
Yes, more Calamityware plate designs are coming in 2015. I’ll keep doing them until you’re sick of them...or I am. I hope calamitous bread plates, bowls, and mugs can get into the mix too. Watch for email updates or like the Calamityware Facebook page for fresh news. Meanwhile, if you have gaps in your Calamityware plate collection or need gifts, visit Calamityware.com. You’ll find BADbandana 1 there too.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The basic techniques of making bandanas are centuries old. But even this simple and mature technology can probably still go wrong in surprising ways. I’ve learned from my previous Kickstarter projects that fiascoes lurk everywhere.

[Cue the inspirational music] 
I can’t promise you that this project will unfold smoothly. It might. But based on recent experience, I doubt that. I’ll do all I can to anticipate problems and vanquish threats. For example, I’m now aligned with a new shipping team (Fulfillrite) for this project in hopes that your rewards will be sent in a much more timely and transparent manner. So far, they have been wonderful to work with.

Whatever happens, I promise to get my sponsors whimsical bandanas as soon as possible after the project closes. Your BADbandanas will reach you in good condition and be ready to enjoy—a distinctive blend of beauty, utility, and humor.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content: Sponsors said they’d like to have a black BADbandana, so I decided to make one in time for Halloween. festooned with spirited skeletons, this design just launched as a Kickstarter project today.

Watch your mailbox. Almost all the BADbandana 2 shipments went out yesterday. The Fulfillrite team is amazingly fast and efficient. So, this project accidentally got lucky and ended way ahead of schedule. Like when you are driving and get all green lights.
If you are one of the few people who failed to answer the Kickstarter survey requesting address information, there’s no package rushing to your door. Why not complete the survey now? It just takes a few seconds.
Don folding furiously this week.

campaign.story:
If you love coffee as much as we do, we're sure you would LOVE to be able to drink it anytime anywhere. And so would we! That is why we decided to make a coffee mug that is practical and sustainable, but is also a fashion accessory and tells the primeval story of coffee.
Its most obvious feature is definitely its shape which resembles the goat´s horns but it also helps you drink that last sip of your coffee and makes you look good.
We designed a special holder with leather touch which simply turns into a coffee mug stand so you can easily keep the Goat mug on your desk.
Also, Goat mug comes with a set of two straps (short and longer part combine in to one), so you can simply attach it to your bag or just let it fall across your shoulder. This way you can carry your books or bags and talk on the phone while carrying your coffee around.
Goat mug is 100% leak proof so don't worry about getting coffee stains on your jeans. It s also safe for your health because it is BPA FREE.
Since you are on-the-go kind of person, we made your life easier by making the Goat´s lid so user friendly, you can easily open and close it with only one hand.
 Here's a look inside the Goat mug. It's shape makes it simple to clean.
We designed a beautiful packaging to deliver your Goat mug in style. It can then become a perfect storage place for your fresh coffee beans.
We would love for more coffee lovers to learn the real story about coffee as much as we would love all of them to be stylish and eco-friendly while drinking their coffee wherever and whenever. That is why we would appreciate you backing our project. Surely, there will be more coffees enjoyed if we manage to make our dream come true.
Help us share our project among other coffee lover out there
Awards structure:
The first stretch goal is an idea we got from our backer Tamara. If we manage to raise $60,000 we will offer everyone a new colour option of the Goat mug - the PANTONE COLOUR OF THE YEAR: MARSALA. Let's do it!
The second stretch goal is out! If we manage to raise $250,000 we will offer a new reward: HEMP EDITION Goat mug - for all those on the relaxed side of fashion.
 Never. Enough. Coffee. You asked for big, we're giving you GRANDE. Third streth goal is set to $350,000! Can we do this together?
If all goes according to our plans, we will be shipping out products already in second half of February. Let's do this together!  
Design of the GOAT STORY Coffee mug was done by design studio Desnahemisfera in cooperation with MyEqua.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Our team has lots of experience with product design, production and tooling processes. We believe that being well prepared, expecting the unexpected and having a back up plan is what makes us trustworthy. 

Since the design of the Goat mug is so different from all other coffee mugs out there, we had to pay special attention to finding the right producers that will enable the production of the Goat mug to run as smoothly as possible. We spent almost a year arranging and optimising all steps in production line. We already financed some parts of necessary tooling, but we need your support in order to finalise all the details and missing parts.

We want to be 100% honest with our customers and will keep you up to date with EVERYTHING. Every bit of change will be posted in our updates section, so you'll always know how far in production or in the shipping process your Goat mug is.

Speaking of shipping... We got that covered too, so you don't have to worry about anything, just sit back and get Goat mug delivered to your door.

campaign.story:
The Story of Lee Knife
Peide Lee was born in 1933 in China. As a young boy of 12, in 1945, Lee traveled to Jiazhou to learn blacksmithing. Only a year later, he had his own shop started to sell kitchen knives, upon which the characters “Lee knife” were engraved. All kinds of people used and praised Lee's knives, from common people to the noble. When Lee had a son of his own, he taught his son the art of smithing knives. Many had heard of Lee's highly-prized knives, but only those in his family could learn how to make them. 
For his skills, Lee became a legend. 
Steel forging is a key technique of making Lee’s knife. After years of experience, he invented over 70 famous forging processes. Manual forging evens out and refines the distribution of carbon contents and in turn greatly improves the overall performance and results such as greater strength, resilience and fatigue resistance of the metal after heat treatment. Therefore, stainless steel has improved ductility after forging without compromising hardness, so the knife can be hard, abrasion-resistant and ductile simultaneously. Following traditional knife forging processes, an iron bar is placed in a furnace until red-hot.
Then, the bar is hammered repeatedly to form the appropriate shape. After it is sanded, quenched, and polished, the knife’s exterior is bright and the interior quality is guaranteed. 
Following the traditional techniques and using modern stainless steel, Lee knives are high in quality, low in price, extremely durable, and well-received by customers.
The blade surfaces are bright, smooth, and spotless; the edges are sharp, straight, and flawless. It is comfortable to handle, stable, and durable. The handle and blade are not welded together but are a single-body.
Knife making has a long history in China, of which Lee knife is an outstanding exemplar. Besides the functions that common kitchen knives possess, Lee knives have distinctive irreplaceable values. Throughout the years, Lee knife is created of high-quality steel and fine craftsmanship. After generations of hard work, Lee knife flies high as a pinnacle in Chinese traditional crafting. Over all this time, Lee knife is still full of life.
Our Perks:
About us
The Lee Knife: Make the Best Kitchen Knife!
As the second generation of the Lee Family, me and my brothers and partners naturally hold the responsibility and destiny to pass along this knife making heritage. It's not only a business, but also a way we treat and respect our life and our own culture. We choose to go to Kickstarter and raise your support and awareness of our undying passion for knife craftsmanship. Your support will also sustain our tradition and make it impact more people.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Knife is not necessarily a dangerous thing, first of all. The biggest challenge though is how to pack them safe and deliver one by one to our backers. Do you have any good suggestion? ^^Y
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Monk & Guru are slim, minimal, and modern wallets that provide excellent protection for your cards and folded cash. They are handcrafted using durable, eco-friendly cork fabrics and elastics. Handcrafted in the U.S.A.
Welcome to the Monk & Guru project. My name is Foad, the Monk and Guru wallets are the first from a line of products that I will be launching with the generous support of the Kickstarter community. To launch these products, I need your help to reach my minimum goal of $3,000 to acquire the necessary raw materials at wholesale price. With the Kickstarter community’s support, I will be able to launch this project and provide an eco-friendly wallet at a fair price.
Features: Hand sewn, stylish, light-weight, secure and durable.
Both Monk & Guru Wallets are made out of sustainable and durable materials. No Animal Product were used in this project.
Colors: Natural Light Brown - Dark Brown - Stripe
             Blue - Yellow - Black
Guru Wallet
Materials:  High Quality Portuguese Cork Fabric, Elastic, Rivets and Hand-waxed Threads.
The Guru Wallet’s elastic slot feature allows it to contain up to 12 cards and some folded cash. This wallet incorporates a minimal design so that it can fit very comfortably in your pocket.
The elastic slot has been cut using a hot cutting machine and sewn together, with cork fabric hand stitched to the elastic section.
Monk Wallet
Materials: High Quality Portuguese Cork Fabric, Rivets and Hand-waxed Threads. 
The Monk Wallet is the ultra-minimal cardholder which can fit 6 cards. It is extra light weight and it fits easily in your pockets.
Update:
Since the campaign is ending soon, I decided to offer all the colors that you see below as limited edition for our Kickstarter backers.
Blue Edition
All Black Edition
Stripe Edition
2K Update:
Cork fabrics are genuinely sustainable, eco-friendly, natural, recyclable, and biodegradable. I absolutely avoid working with pvc backings, and instead, I use a water based adhesive for the textile backings. As a result, the cork fabrics have a soft and natural touch. The colored corks are also dyed instead of printed, so the colors will not wear off.
There are many wallet projects on Kickstarter, but here are several reasons for you to support the Monk & Guru Project.
- High quality natural Portuguese cork, a renewable and biodegradable raw material, were used in the making of the Monk & Guru Wallets.
- Guarantee We will repair or replace any defects in materials or workmanship within one year of receiving the wallets.
- 30-days money back guarantee - no questions asked
- The wallets are laser cut for precision, and hand stitched with waxed threads for durability.
- These unique, handmade, environmental, and animal friendly wallets are affordable

The minimum $3,000 will be used to purchase raw material in bulk. Buying raw materials in bulk will allow me to market the Monk and Guru Wallets at an affordable and competitive price. For this project’s generous Kickstarter backers, I will offer these products at a discounted price.
Part of the funding helps us to buy a branding iron, in order to emboss our logo on the products properly.
This funding will also kick-start my e-commerce website, comfygoods.com, the main site where the Monk and Guru Wallets will be marketed and sold.
I would love to hear your feedback, so please stay connected and contact me at:
contact@comfygoods.com
personal email: contact.foad@gmail.com
Credits:
Special thanks to Holy Grounds Coffee & Tea for letting us record some videos.
Music was produced by DJ Corbett  blacklightmusiconline.com
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I know every start-up company faces numerous challenges and this company is no exception. The main risk we are currently facing is the possibility of delays in acquiring raw materials. This can delay production. To resolve this potential issue, I have contacted numerous manufacturers to ensure that I have multiple back-ups that can provide me with the necessary raw materials.
Further, since it is my genuine goal to efficiently deliver quality products to consumers, I have meticulously devised a business plan capable of handling large production demands. In order to carry out this business plan, among other actions, I have secured the commitment of numerous local wallet makers to collaborate in the mass production of the Monk and Guru Wallets.
Great customer service is my personal guarantee to you. Please support this project with confidence. Thank you.

campaign.story:
I LOVE HARRY POTTER!
A little nerd cred: I've read all the books 4 times (I think?) and have listened to the audio books (usually while jogging) twice. No joke: I can't read (or listen to) Book 7 without crying. Like a baby.

Speaking of babies, my son is only 4 1/2 months old but as soon as he's old enough you better BELIEVE that HP and his crew will be putting my little man to sleep. I'm so excited to share these stories with him.

This is going to sound incredibly corny, but my favorite thing about the series is this idea: Love Is The Most Powerful Magic. The idea that having your friends and family around you is the most important thing. These concepts are integral to the books. You're taken on this amazing journey and by the end, you can really feel the truth of those ideas. They're made abundantly clear. They're made obvious. I love that.

WHO ARE YOU?

I'm Jonathan Mann! I’ve been writing a new song everyday and posting it to youtube for the last 2000+ days:
I write about all kinds of stuff from politics to video games to science to what’s going on in my life to - well sometimes I just write about not knowing what to write about. Over the course of the last 6 years of song a day, I've written a handful of songs based on the Harry Potter series. These songs just kind of come out - there's not a lot of forethought in it. They really just arrive, and I'm like, "OK, I guess we're writing another Harry Potter song! Awesome!"
Anyway, there's five of these songs especially that are really good! None of them are about Harry directly - they're more like fan fiction in song form: 
What if the character that Bruce Willis always plays worked for the Ministry of Magic? What if a child born to a magical family turned 11, got no letter, and snuck his way to Hogwarts? What if Voldemort had chosen Neville? 
These are the kinds of things I explore in these songs.

WHY KICKSTARTER?
The songs are mostly recorded, but there's still a lot to do. I don't want to put theses songs out half-finished. Song A Day is all about working quickly, getting the ideas out there and not worrying about "perfection". But then when it comes time to make a record, I want to be totally sure that everything is as perfect as possible! 
First of all, the songs have "midi drums" on them, which means they're programmed into the computer - they're not real. There's a big difference between getting a real drummer to play on a track vs. programming the computer - something is always lost when only using midi. (Sometimes it's OK, like for all kinds of electronic music, but these songs are more in the folk-rock-pop vein and the midi drums just don't cut it.) My good friend Jesse Olson Bay will play the drums. He's a true artist. Jesse's charging $1000. 
There's also 3 of the tracks that are just screaming out for horns. They're like, "We're good and all, but when you put horns on us, we'll MELT YOUR FACE!" I can't play any brass or woodwind instruments, so I'm turning to my friend Matthew Joseph Payne to help orchestrate and record the horn parts. Matt's charging $1300. Matt does amazing work.

Finally, the songs need to be mixed and mastered. Mixing an album just means taking all of the elements and putting them in their proper sonic place - sort of like working with potions. All the ingredients need to be just right, from the EQ to the compression to the reverb and the panning and levels. My friend Nick Krill of The Spinto Band and Teen Men is just the wizard for the job. Nick will charge $1800.
Mastering is a really tricky business. To tell you the honest truth, I don't totally understand what goes into it. All I know is that when I send my tracks to Jeff Lipton at Peerless Mastering to be mastered, they already sound great - but when I get them back, they SOUND FREAKING INCREDIBLE. He's worked with The Magnetic Fields, Arcade Fire, LCD Soundsystem and many more. He's truly the Headmaster of mastering. Jeff charges me $1500.
This adds up to $5600. Not a ton of money, but I definitely can't afford it alone! 
ALBUM RELEASE
I'm releasing this EP digital only because frankly, that's the format I prefer when buying music! You may disagree - that's cool. Let me know if you do - if enough people ask for a physical object (CD, record or other), I'd start thinking about making a stretch goal. For now, though, with the scope of this project, it really makes sense for me to just do digital only. 
THAT'S IT!I can't wait to share these songs with you! Harry potter means so much to me. I also want to shout out to all the amazingly inspiring Wizard Rock (Wrock?) bands out there - I hope to join your ranks with the release of this record!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I've gone through this process many times before, and I've worked with all the people involved on multiple occasions. So I'm very, very confident that we'll get this project done.

That being said, all but two of us has a kid (Matt's got two as of a month or so ago!! Congrats Matt), and kids are definitely a challenge to the creative process! We'll get the recording, mixing and mastering done for sure. 

The only real challenge I forsee is if I max out some of the backer rewards: If I end up having to write 200 minisongs and draw 200 pictures - it may take me longer than I think. But I will do my best - and I will definitely get it done.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content: Matt is doing the horn arranging and playing on the Harry Potter EP. This is his apology for holding things up. His life is kind of crazy right now.

Long time no update! Hello! We are waiting on the horns.
My horn composer and player, Matt, has just gone through a huge transition: Leaving his longtime job and moving to a new home in a new town. He had a trumpet player lined up back where he used to live, but now he's been looking for someone new because it'd be just too far to travel for the old trumpet player. The other day, he suggested that maybe he could just play the horn parts himself on this little plastic trombone that belongs to his son! I think this is a great idea; I told him to go for it! So I think that will be done very soon!

updates.update_userinfo: Horn Purgatory! Part TWO! (with a video apology)
updates.update_content:
Just a quick update: My friend Jesse Olson Bay has completed the drums! THEY SOUND AMAZING! Hooray! Now I'm sending the tracks to Matthew Joseph Payne so he can lay down some awesome horn lines. So excited to hear what he comes up with.
Thanks for being patient! Rewards and music and all kinds of stuff soon!
<3<3<3<3<3<3 x 100000000

Getting lots of great responses on the reward surveys! Great work everyone!
I'm trying to decide when exactly to start making and sending this stuff out. I'm thinking that it might be a cool thing to make and release all the drawings and songs in the lead up to the release of the album and then as promotion for the album once it's out. 
An estimate of this timeline would put the songs and drawings starting to be made around early December, and carry on through January and February.

Thanks so much everyone! I'll keep you all updated here as I move forward with the various phases of producing out the album. Jesse, who's doing the drums, won't be available to do them until November, and that's our first step. So for now, I'm going to make some tweaks to the music and then export the final stems (stems are just a fancy way of saying individual tracks) and get everything ready.
Here's a few FAQs:
