campaign.story:
Missed the Kickstarter campaign? Please go to www.butterup.com.au
No more tears on toast!
Say goodbye to hard clumps of butter ripping apart your morning toast with ButterUp. The Stupendous Splendiferous ButterUp quickly turns cold, hard butter into sumptuous easy to spread ribbons of dairy goodness.
Built in grater
Our unique design features a built in grater to aerate and soften butter making it easy to spread. Easy to spread also means you use less too. The grater shape has been specifically designed for butter and to avoid sharp edges so cleanup is safe and easy.
Broad spreading blade
 A wider blade helps to collect the grated butter as well as provide more surface area for easy spreading.
Dishwasher safe
ButterUp! is made from stainless steel that is dishwasher safe and long lasting. Choose from a classic polished finish or a modern satin finish.
Development and prototypes
We have developed ButterUp! over many months and prototypes to refine the design to make sure that its easy to use and easy to clean when you're done.
Just some of the not so stupendous prototypes we developed in the workshop to 3D printed stainless steel and aluminium machined samples to test what worked and what didn't. After lots of trial and error, buttered bread and many months of tooling refinement we are ready for ButterUp! to spread world wide.
What next?
In order to provide you with a great product we need to meet the minimum order quantity from our supplier. This is where your support and helping spread the word is the most important part of this whole project!
Thankyou so much for your support and helping spread the love!
Ordering more than 1?  
Due to huge demand for multiples you can simply add to your initial pledge! Additional knives are $10 each and you can add up to 4 (5 total). International shipping is still $6!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We are committed to delivering a well executed high quality product. Working closely with an experienced cutlery manufacturer we have already addressed production issues to refine the manufacturing process and tooling design and we are production ready. We also have people at hand to help out with logistics and delivery once the campaign is successful. Also we understand our own limitations which is why we have taken into consideration a realistic timeframe for the first production. We want to exceed expectation, not over promise.

campaign.story:
elemoon combines a touch interface, activity sensor, notifications & colorful lights into an elegant accessory that syncs with you.
As seen in...
                 Customizable jewelry that syncs with you!
elemoon is the world's first smart accessory that lets you change its light designs to match every outfit or occasion. elemoon can also alert you to important calls, find your phone if you lose it and much more!
 NEW FEATURE: ACTIVITY TRACKING
Thanks to your support and suggestions, we are adding Activity Tracking to the features that elemoon offers! We've talked to our engineering team and are brainstorming on even more new features we can enable via software updates with our current hardware! This means for every backer supporting elemoon, new features will be available as we grow!
elemoon comes in 2 different sizes.
  Hardware Details
Bluetooth Low Energy
G-Sensor
75 Individually Addressable RBG LED's
Estimated Battery Life: Varies by usage, 1 day up to 1 week.
Magnetic Charging
We’ve always wanted to make tech products more humane and convey more emotions. A year ago, the emergence of wearable technology captured our imagination. We knew that software combining hardware could bring truly emotional experiences and be a bigger part of people’s lives.  
At the very beginning, we knew we wanted to make something different. We decided to start with a bracelet and gradually master the art and science of a whole jewelry line: necklaces, earrings, cufflinks—you name it! 
Everyone on our team is obsessed with colors and Native American jewelry. And we have an eclectic taste in fashion. So we started to imagine recreating traditional jewelry with futuristic material and interactive features. 
We asked ourselves: What if we could have a bracelet that changes color and pattern to match whatever we wear? Half a year later, we made our first working prototype.
We traveled to New Mexico to study traditional Native American jewelry art.
We drew inspiration from impressionist paintings.
We brought in creative talents from all over the world.
elemoon 3D modeling
Different generations of elemoon prototype
Building the prototype
Assembling elemoon
elemoon app design
We need $100K  to meet the minimums to manufacture elemoon with the right parts at a quality factory. This includes the custom hardware, tooling, finishing, quality controls and more. This will also allow us to finish the core development of the elemoon app for iPhone and Android.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Mass production is one of the biggest challenges for smart devices. Fortunately, our team members have 10 years of experience in producing wearables. We have already lined up an incredible team and the top factories to deliver this stellar bracelet to you.  

However, there’s always the risk of delay in any manufacturing process. We will communicate with our backers throughout the process to keep everyone informed and up to date on our progress. Thank you.

updates.update_content:
Dear elemoon backers,
Thank you for your continuous support and enthusiasm! In the past few months, we have been building our team, from customer support to visual storytelling.
It took us some time to put together the video tutorial. Because we always see the poetry of technology, we want to deliver that experience in our tutorial, too. Everything has to be SEXY. ;)

Dear elemoon backers,
I’d like to personally apologize for sporadic updates in recent weeks.
I have some wonderful news to share. After more than 2 months, our elemoon app has finally been approved by Apple and is now available in the App Store, and continues to be available for Android.

Dear backers,
While you are anxiously waiting for your elemoon, I’d love to share with you elemoon in action!
Today elemoon is launching on the luxury online shop http://www.ahalife.com! AHA is an e-commerce site that celebrates tasteful discovery. It was founded by a fellow female entrepreneur Shauna, ranked as top 50 Most Innovative Companies by Fast Magazine in 2013, with influential curators like Tim Gunn and Donna Karan (DKNY).

Dear elemoon backers,
We are thrilled to announce that elemoon 1.0 is on your way! We've learned that clearing customs takes time and our initial tracking numbers will not be valid once each shipping box gets out of the carton. We’ve hired a fulfillment company to tackle the logistics and will keep you posted about the status.
Since elemoon 1.0 will be “in the wild” in any coming day, I’d like to thank everyone for your patience, support and believing in us. As promised, I’m sharing with you a sneak-peek of our elemoon app and some personal stories of what's motivated me to make elemoon.

Dear elemoon backers,
I want to thank you again for your patience and continuous support. We have some exciting news for you!
As you all know, before the Valentine’s Day, I made a hard decision: not to ship elemoon till it’s perfect. In today’s tech world, it’s way too common to ship a “good enough” product and iterate as users discover defects. I believe that’s why wearable tech has been limiting itself in the early adopter’s market.

Dear elemoon backers,
I’m writing to let you know that elemoon will not ship in time for Valentine’s Day. And I want to personally apologize to everyone who is eagerly awaiting the bracelet.
I’ve been in the factory day and night over the past three months to get elemoon ready. Unfortunately, we have had some last minute bugs in our firmware we need to resolve before shipping. Everything is ready for the first 2,000 units including the 3D printed packaging.

Today, we built our first black elemoon in the factory. It was our best day ever!
I’ve attached some photos I took in the factory today with my iPhone. Even the least romantic male workers in the factory rolled their eyes and told me that they “saw stars” when they saw the elemoon LEDs light up for the first time. I was surrounded by men staring at the product they had made, amazed at how beautiful it was. Men!

Dear backers,
Are you getting ready to celebrate the holidays? We are, in the factories! As some of you may know, we’re not taking any breaks till we ship!
Here are a few production updates.
Materials

Dear elemoon backers,
Greetings from our factory! In the last 8 weeks, we have been working tirelessly to make elemoon come to life. We've added a number of improvements during the production process, like optimizing our firmware and tweaking the motherboard and mold until they're just right. As the first wearable team to combine electronics and high-end jewelry manufacturing on a mass scale, we've encountered a lot of new challenges, but it's been a rewarding experience. And we continue to test and enhance the stability of the hardware and software daily!

project_data.project_name: elemoon | wearable tech that expresses your unique style.

campaign.story:
I like drawings that make me laugh. When I inherited a traditional Blue Willow-pattern plate, I just had to redraw it and add a pterodactyl. As I drew more plates and added more calamities—UFOs, Sasquatch, and volcanoes—folks urged me to produce real dinner plates. A Kickstarter project was born.
The first three Kickstarter projects (flying monkey, giant robot, voracious sea monster) found sponsors, so here is the fourth project in what might turn out to be a long series. This design includes a fleet of flying saucers. Imagine finding those bad boys behind your quiche!
Prototype of Calamityware plate 4
The final production plates will feature a rich blue image on white porcelain. You can hang it on your wall or use it for dinner (food safe, microwave safe, dishwasher safe). Makes a really astonishing gift.
If we get enough sponsors, the craftspeople at Bryan China Company (New Castle, PA, USA) will transfer the elements of my drawing by hand to full-size dinner plates and fire them at 1500 degrees to permanently fuse the image to the porcelain. I expect to ship these plates before the end of November 2014. You can lavish Calamityware 4 plates on friends and family as holiday gifts. 
Series continues. I’m committed to producing at least six plate designs in this series. If sponsors remain enthusiastic, I’ll go to 12.
Here’s the current lineup.
Calamityware Plate 1: flying monkeys
Calamityware Plate 2: giant robot
Calamityware Plate 3: voracious sea monster
Calamityware Plate 4: UFO invasion
In the future I see pirates, volcanoes, tentacles, pterodactyls, the vortex of doom, and a plethora of obnoxious creatures. But probably not all those calamities at once. Watch for updates as the lineup emerges.
Previous Calamityware plates
If you missed the previous Kickstarter projects and want to address a gap in your Calamityware plate collection, you’ll find earlier plates at BuyCalamityware.com
Will all the plates in this series match? No. The designs of the plate borders and central image will be very different. It’s also possible that the exact size of the plates and the shade of blue will shift slightly because the plates, transfers, and firing are going to be happening at different times, months apart. If you are a perfectionist about matching, you should order a set of identical dishes with the same design on all.
How can I get a collection of different designs? If you want each of your dinner guests to have a different calamity, the best way is to sponsor each of the successive Kickstarter projects. I’m trying to space these projects 90 days apart. So it is going to take a while. 
What about international shipping? If you live outside the US, you’ll need to order your Calamityware plates on the BuyCalamityware.com website. Plates are heavy and fragile, so lugging them to distant parts is a major effort. Rather than have a flat rate for all international shipments and charge some people too much and others too little, this approach allows the giant robot to calculate realistic shipping costs for each international address. 
What if I live in Canada? Shipping to Canada is considered international too. So you’ll need to visit BuyCalamityware.com to order plates and add the appropriate international shipping cost.
Why are pledge amounts higher than the previous project? My goal for Calamityware was never to get rich, but at the start I promised my wife, The Amazing Karen, that I wouldn’t lose money on my silly plates. Then I immediately started losing money. Unfortunately, the pledge levels I posted for the first three Kickstarter projects have not been high enough to cover ALL the costs. That didn’t matter much when I only had 200 sponsors, but as Calamityware has attracted more fans, my low pledge levels have gotten me in trouble.
Shipping costs have proven to be significantly higher than I was initially promised. Then there was a rate increase. The cost of porcelain blanks and shipping cartons has crept up too. Kickstarter and Amazon each end up taking a full five percent cut. The tax man wants a share too. And there are a host of little marketing and logistics costs that no one anticipated. It’s amazing how much skywriters charge these days. Pledge as much as you can and help save my marriage.
More back story. Sponsors of this project will receive periodic updates through Kickstarter as the project unfolds. You can also receive a trickle of news about designing, producing, and enjoying Calamityware plates by liking the Calamityware Facebook page.
If you want even more details about Calamityware plates, take a look at the previous Calamityware Kickstarter projects, the videos, and the updates I shared. Search on the term “calamityware” or follow this link to the previous project. Check out the video.
Want to see more of Don’s drawings? I post a new drawing of something almost every day on Flickr. You can see my preliminary Calamityware sketches and drawings in this Flickr album.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
A little optimism can be a good thing. Without some optimism, not much would happen. Explorers would not start on new quests. Artists would not begin masterpieces. And no one would get out of bed in the morning. But optimism also gets mankind in a heap of trouble by blinding us to all the things that can go wrong.

I have started each of my three Kickstarter projects with optimism. Each time, fate has rebuked me with astonishing swiftness. I continue to be amazed at the number of things that can go awry on a fairly simple project.

The basic techniques of making plates are thousands of years old. But even this simple and mature technology can still go wrong in surprising ways. And because even simple Kickstarter projects require the efforts of many different people, I’ve learned about the richly varied ways that people can throw a monkey wrench into the works. In this context, the expression “throw a monkey-wrench into the works” isn’t literal but instead refers to the wide variety of ways that people can thwart my tidy plans. And because Kickstarter projects happen in both the real world and the digital world, they are also vulnerable to everything from snow storms to cyber shenanigans.

Let me list just a few of the episodes that caused trouble during the first three Calamityware Kickstarter projects:
* The Tempermental Kiln
* The Elusive Proof
* The Incomprehensible Customs Form
* The Thursday of Compounded Confusions
* The Slow Boat From China
* The Wrong Box
* The Un-photogenic Lasagna
* Funerals and Other Unpleasant Distractions

My team eventually overcame all of these challenges and my sponsors got their plates (most without any delays). We will crush these challenges if they appear again. The maddening thing is this. Those specific problems probably won’t appear again. Instead, the universe will fling new and unexpected problems at us—calamities that we can’t even imagine.

This is where optimists get in trouble. At least an imaginative pessimist is ready—armed with the knowledge that something is probably going to go wrong. The pessimist knows that projects are prone to sink in quicksand, wander into dangerous traffic, or explode. A true pessimist with real-world experience knows a triple is possible. A project can sink in quicksand, wander into dangerous traffic, AND explode all in one gruesome day.

I have come to believe that Fate favors the scenario that creates the greatest mess.

[Cue the inspirational music]
I can’t promise you that this project will unfold smoothly. It might. But based on recent experience, I doubt that. I’ll do all I can to anticipate problems and vanquish threats. Whatever happens, I promise to get my sponsors whimsical plates as soon as possible after the project closes. Your plates will reach you in good condition and be ready to enjoy—a distinctive blend of beauty, utility, and humor.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
I hope you have been enjoying your Calamityware plate 4 with UFOs. I hung mine on a wall in my kitchen. Looks good.
Sponsors asked for Calamityware mugs, so I made that project a priority.
(Cue the dramatic music.) My new Kickstarter project launched today—Things-Could-Be-Worse Mugs.

campaign.story:
Ballerinas, princesses and ladybugs for girls... Cars, construction vehicles, and sports for boys.
Are you bored of these "boy" and "girl" motifs? Ever wish you could find some baby duds that look modern, charming, and not too super girly or super boyish?
So do I! That's why I am starting Jessy & Jack: to produce baby and toddler clothes and accessories with graphics and decorations that look adorable on both little boys AND little girls. Jessy & Jack clothes and accessories will be available in different color schemes, including blues and pinks, but the graphics and themes that adorn them will be gender-neutral. You'll find the same sweet designs on the pink items as the blue ones, and I promise you'll never ever catch us slapping a giant bow on a character's head to make it "girly."
We have stretch goals (including bonuses for our backers)!
$3k - We'll launch with six bib designs. ACHIEVED!
$4k - We'll add t-shirts to the launch product list AND as an extra thank you, everyone who pledged at the $10 level or above will receive their choice of 1) an additional Jessy & Jack Superbib, or 2) an additional set of 3 Jessy & Jack folded notecards! That will mean that everyone gets rewards worth more than what they pledged.
Bibs for the Babes
Anyone who has spent time with a baby knows that you often see more of their bibs than their shirts. So our first product for babies is a sturdy, absorbent, 100% cotton Superbib decorated with our signature character pairs. I created a prototype for this bib that incorporates all the things I like best from the many different bibs I have tried with my own two kiddos, plus a few of my own unfulfilled bib wishes. I'm having it manufactured custom by a high-end garment factory.
Here's what's great about the Jessy & Jack bib:
Easy-to-reach snaps close at the side instead of in the back
It has snaps instead of Velcro (no scratched baby necks!)
It has two snaps, so it's adjustable to fit the tiniest necks and expand as your baby grows
It's 100% cotton, because fluffy polyester blends can feel silky and soft, but when you want to soak up liquid they really let you down
It's a generous size to absorb endless buckets of drool
The bibs will be made of 100% cotton jersey on the front. The first line will feature a grey and white chevron pattern on the front, and white 100% cotton terry backing for absorbency. We'll applique and embroider our signature character pairs on the front in 100% cotton jersey and cotton terry. We'll launch with two or three of these character pairs and a few different color schemes, for a total of five unique combinations.
Tees for the Tots
T-shirts! Can any toddler have too many of them? My son has a drawer full, and picking out his shirt for the day is one of the high points of his morning. But he has so few options aside from the same old boy stuff. It's either trucks, dinosaurs, sharks, or sports... or plain shirts or stripes. Don't our kids deserve a little more variety?
Jessy & Jack Toddler Tees will be decorated with a pair of unlikely friends from different walks of life that look cute on both boys and girls. Our Kickstarter reward tees will feature our signature elephant and robot buddies, and when we launch the full t-shirt line we'll do it with three different character pairs: elephant & robot, monster & chicken, and owl & rhinoceros.
Our high-quality 100% cotton tees are made by American Apparel in the U.S.A. and screen printed in Seattle. The shirts will be available in 2T, 4T, and 6T (American Apparel skips sizes, so no 3/5T).
Where Will the Kickstarter Money Go?
After Kickstarter fees, reward costs and shipping expenses, the $2,500 funding target for this campaign will cover about half the startup costs of forming the legal business entity, obtaining necessary licenses and permits, registering to obtain UPCs to sell Jessy & Jack products at retail, registering a domain, setting up a web store, working with a designer to create two additional character pairs and format care tags, hang tags, and patterns, and producing a limited run of baby bibs in five different designs.
If this campaign is successful I expect to have product available on Amazon, the Jessy & Jack web site, and select retail outlets by November.
About Those Rewards...
The Superbib will retail for $10-12, and t-shirts will retail for $21.99. The reward levels reflect these retail prices plus the cost of Kickstarter and Amazon Payments fees (10%), shipping, packaging, and a limited-edition greeting card that pairs with the bib to make a sweet gift for that special parent, baby, or toddler in your life (or, if you're buying for your own kids, makes a fantastic thank you card).
I expect to be able to fulfill bib rewards by October, but have indicated a fulfillment date of November to be conservative. T-shirts for Kickstarter backers will definitely be available in October.
For those backers selecting t-shirts, I'll get in touch with you  later get your color and size choices.
My Qualifications:
I'm a full-time working mother of two: a toddler boy who loves both cars and butterflies, and a baby girl who is draped over my shoulder and sleeping peacefully as I type this (one-handed). By day I work at an Internet retailer; evenings and weekends find me basking in the magic of my children's early years while simultaneously brewing product and design ideas. I started Jessy & Jack in the final weeks of my second maternity leave. I have an MBA and many years of business management experience.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The primary risk is that my manufacturer may not produce bibs of the quality I expect. Should this happen, I'll need to drop the retail price to reflect a more "average" product. If that is the case I will adjust Kickstarter backers' rewards accordingly to deliver good value for your contributions. However, I have been in talks with the factory -- which primarily manufactures luxury gowns and other high-end garments -- for quite some time and am giving them detailed instructions, diagrams, fabric samples, and specifications. I am confident they will produce a quality product.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content: It's been just about a year since I launched the Jessy & Jack web site, and we got a pretty amazing birthday present today - a feature in Mashable that has been shared 4,000 times in a day or two (http://on.mash.to/1hjDrmm).

Hello friends!
Things are moving along nicely over here in the land of Jessy & Jack. I received the first set of sample bibs from our production contractor last week, and they looked pretty awesome. They need a few tweaks (slight change to the shape, a couple color changes, a reinforced snap to handle the weight of the thick fabrics), so we'll be doing a second round of samples before moving to production. But the fabrics are really soft and just the right thickness, and the colors look beautiful. Here's a picture of my in-house baby product tester wearing one of the first samples. She's been known to soak several bibs a day, so she is highly qualified for the job.
Courtney

Hello, wonderful Kickstarter supporters! I am so excited to share some really awesome news with you guys.
The very first Jessy & Jack t-shirt has been printed, and I couldn't be more proud of it. Ladies and gentlemen, I give you Owl & Rhino on grass green tee, eagerly shot by iPhone:

Hello, wonderful Kickstarter supporters!
I want to share a little news with you guys about progress. Things are really rolling over here. 
Notecards: They're printed and waiting to be sent out to all of you (once their companion products are here)!

Good morning, wonderful Kickstarter backers! 
We are successfully funded! Together we raised $3624 to go out and make some cute stuff for boys AND girls. That meets the original goal for bib production and the $3000 stretch goal to launch with six bibs instead of five. 
Remember that $4k stretch goal to make t-shirts? I wrote about a week ago that if we hit it, I'd give every backer at the $10 level and above a bonus gift of three folded notecards or a bib. Well,  I know it doesn't look like it, but two generous backers sent checks that put us over the line. In fact we have raised a total of $4224. T-shirts are coming, and so are your bonus gifts! I will get in touch to get your choices when I have photographs of the actual products, which is looking like another month or so.

campaign.story:
Handmade awesomeness, full of fluffy, just for you.
 This project showcases the first original pattern I created.
 These octopus babies are hand-knit with wool-free yarn and use safety eyes that make them safe for babies and machine washable. Each one takes between 5-8 hours to make by hand. (They are made in a cat friendly environment. If you would like one made in a pet free setting please let me know.)
These little knitted octopi are super snuggly and made for display, play, or snuggly purposes. They can be used as a stress ball or decoration or participant in taking over pirate ships.
 Each one comes with a personality and a name.
 Supporting this project allows for me to create something new, acquire materials and test patterns to create additional projects in the future.
Thank you hearts:
Samples of sweet babies:
  Left: Big daddy (also functions as a silly hat) Right: Little mama-pus
 Maddie holding Judith the giant octopus.
 Add ons!
  Knitted heart: Increase your pledge by $5 and shoot me a message to let me know. Also include color preference if any.
Baby octopus: Increase your pledge by $18 and shoot me a message to let me know. Also include color preference if any.
 "When buying from an artist/maker, you're buying more than just an object/painting. You are buying hundreds of hours of failures and experimentation. You are buying days, weeks & months of frustration and moments of pure joy. YOU AREN'T JUST BUYING A THING, you're buying a piece of heart, part of a soul, a moment of someone's life. Most importantly, you're buying the artist more time to do something they are passionate about." - unknown
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The biggest challenge and risk of course is time. This is a one (wo)man show so everything is created by hand by me. While this means that each person is getting an original piece of craft this also means that each octopus takes several hours to make. Luckily with repetition comes speed and each octopus takes a little less time to make. I am able to knit almost every day and have already started a wave of octopus babies which are currently flooding my living room.


The rest of the octopuses (babies, mamas, and big daddies) will be completed after the fundraising ends. The hope is that fall 2015 would be the absolute latest date for the delivery of the octopuses.


Money Back Guarantee - If you're not completely satisfied with the final product, you may return it for a full refund.

Here are some examples of completed sample projects, which are also available as rewards and will ship out in September!
This month has been really exciting for me and Maddie!!!
I just wanted to take a minute to wish all the mommies out there a Happy Mother's Day!

So good news, bad news: Good news is I DO NOT need brain surgery! The bad news... they have no idea what caused my brain hemorrhage. My primary doctor wants me to stay home an additional month and wait until after I see two specialists before I try to return to work. This also means a month without working and I need some help. If you are interested in helping or reading more updates on the health side of what is going on please click here:

As many of you know, I recently went into the hospital with a brain hemorrhage Today they discharged me. They do not know what caused it and I will be doing a follow up MRI in four to six weeks. I got to go home today, but I will be slowly getting back into my routine and will be mostly trying to sleep this week. Please be patient with me. 
For day to day updates and pictures of octopus as they are made check out the Twitter page:

I needed to communicate something that has happened. Yesterday Friday March 26th, I drove into work, poured my coffee and turned on my phone. I answered the first call of the day (I work in a call center) and in the middle of a sentence a sharp, stabbing pain hit the back of my head. It felt like the back of my head was bleeding on the inside, I had tunnel vision and I was in so much pain I felt like I was going to throw up and black out and I could not stop crying. I wrote HELP ME on a post it and held it up until someone saw me and got a supervisor. A coworker carried me to her car and drove me to the ER. At the ER they did a CT scan and I was told I had a brain aneurysm. They immediately strapped me into a stretcher and rushed me to the hospital. I was admitted last night and had an MRI and in the morning they did an angiogram.  I am not sure if surgery will be needed and the doctors are not sure at this point in time what is causing the bleeding in my cerebellum. Last night I had an MRI that showed my brain was bruised and bleeding and this morning I had an angiogram which ruled out vasculitis. Today I had an EKG which was irregular. I don't know how appropriate a picture of me laying in a hospital bed is right now, but for the sake of proof I will post it. At this point all I know is that my brain is bruised and was bleeding and my heart is irregular. I need additional tests (another CT, a spinal tap, and an echo of my heart). I don't know how long I ill be in the hospital or what treatment will be needed. I will keep you updated as I can.
For day to day updates and pictures of octopus as they are made check out the Twitter page:

campaign.story:
Meet Popup Lighting
Popup lighting is a unique wall fixture that combines functionality and art.
Functionality & Art: The fixture is used both as a lamp and a piece of art. Illuminating any room with warm light, it captures the eye with its unique artistic style.
A 'Wow' effect, every time: Each time you flip the switch, the light's reflection on the wall exposes the true form of the fixture – the combination of metal and light inspiring the senses, time and time again.
Instant Ambiance: Create unforgettable ambiance in any room.
A Modern Classic: A contemporary interpretation of a classic icon, offering a modern design of a timeless theme.
 Find more details and pre-order your Popup Lighting lamp at popuplighting.com
Classic edition- photoshop free
REWARDS
THE STORY
Popup lighting is a light fixture inspired by popup books. The idea was to turn every day icons into artistic and elegant lamps. The clean shape of the lamp is amplified by the light's reflection on the wall, creating a 'wow effect' and making the ambiance in the room magical… Bringing back that excitement and naivety we felt when we opened our first popup book. 
photoshop free
WHEN LIGHT MEETS ART
Popup lighting was made to bring a unique ambience to any space. The game of light and space turns the lamp into a work of art, painting itself all over again every time it's lit. With a simple flip of the switch, beams of light turn into brush strokes turning the lamp into a work of art that dramatically changes the atmosphere, setting the mood and sparking the imagination.
photoshop free
THE INSPIRATION
When I was a child I loved popup books, they had the ability to take me into a world of fantasy and magic that always inspired my dreams. Each time I flipped a page I was sent down the rabbit hole, and just like Alice in Wonderland, I discovered a new fantasy world hidden in the ordinary looking book – the surprise making the magic all the more real.
Growing up, those feelings of magic and fantasy were getting harder and harder to find. That's why I created Popup Lighting. I always felt that there was something magical about light, so, with my passion for art and design I created a light fixture that would bring those nostalgic feelings of magic, excitement and innocence back into our everyday lives and by doing so, allow us to share them with our friends and loved ones.
THE DEER HEAD
The Deer Head lamp is a wall-mounted light fixture that can be used to light a multitude of spaces. It's a classic, nostalgic wall piece given a contemporary and sophisticated interpretation.
When lit, the Deer Head lamp creates a magical ambience. It's perfect for any situation; romantic moments in intimate spaces or magical fantasy in a child's bedroom.
photo by Noa Bellerstein
HOW IT WORKS
The lamp is made with a laser cutting technique, followed by a metal folding process that gives the lamp a clean contemporary origami feel. The parts are then painted and assembled into the final form of the fixture. The fixture is equipped with energy efficient LED lighting modules. With a simple flip of the switch or pull on the handle (premium edition) the picture is completed by the light's reflection on the wall, creating the classical Deer Head icon on your wall. The lamp is ideal for low-light environments and even, as a night light. 
assembling process
SPECS
Mounting- Wall pendant.
Lamp (Bulb) Description- 3*4 LED module 2700k 120lm- 1.5w.
Environment- Indoor.
Technical and Product Description- Decorative lamp, painted folded aluminum and steel.
Operation - Classic edition - wall or cable switch. Premium edition - wall switch or manual mechanical operation.
Voltage (V)- 110- 230.
Construct material- Aluminum, steel.
Weight- 5.5 Ibs (2.5 kl)
Color- Standard (gold and brown) and custom.
TIMELINE
owl- in development...
peacock- in development...
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We spent a long time perfecting the design of popup lighting. We vetted several factories in order to ensure that we would be working with trusted partners. Manufacturing a new product always carries risk and potential delays. We will be fully transparent with our backers on any developments or delays.

-Shipping 
We have planned extra time for the manufacturing process and are determined to deliver on the projected date. In the event of any delays, we will update our backers on any changes to the delivery schedule.

-Manufacturing 
We have gone through several prototype iterations with our suppliers to ensure the high quality of craft and an understanding of our timeline.

-Product 
Popup lighting went through numerous prototype iterations to test for performance, quality and flawless operation. Once production begins, the light fixtures will undergo full electrical inspection and UL certification in order to meet the highest US and EU standards.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
This Kickstarter campaign is now over — thanks to everyone for such tremendous support! To download a free PDF, buy print copies, or anything else, please visit www.leannebrown.ca/cookbooks.
This page is now frozen until the end of time, but to see what the page looked like while the Kickstarter campaign was still active, read on!
-----
Good and Cheap is a gorgeous cookbook for tight budgets. It's free online, but let's get it out to more people by funding a print run.
You can already download a PDF for free on my website at www.leannebrown.ca/cookbooks. Thanks to the support of a bunch of awesome strangers on Reddit, on Tumblr, and elsewhere, it's been amazingly popular — over 200,000 people have downloaded the draft version!
But I want your help to fund printed copies so that we can get Good and Cheap into the hands of people who don't have computers or who wouldn't otherwise see it. The expensive part of printing books is the initial set-up; the cost of each additional copy is fairly low. The more books you buy, the more I can donate or sell at a massive discount to organizations that support low-income families on SNAP (the modern name for Food Stamps).
What's the book like?
Just download a free PDF and take a look for yourself! But since you asked, it's 132 pages (so far!) of beautifully designed and photographed recipes that fit into a $4/day budget — without seeming like it. This is good food that happens to be inexpensive.
If you downloaded the book when it first when viral, grab a new copy: the earlier version was just a draft, but the final version of Good and Cheap has been edited and redesigned throughout.
What's your plan?
I want this book to be as accessible as possible. That's why I've made it free online, and nearly 200,000 downloads to date proves there is both a willing audience and a need.
My dream is that everyone who could benefit from this book would be able to get a copy, at whatever price they can afford. For many, that means keeping it free — even in printed form.
Because printed books cost money, a scheme was born: $25 buys one copy for you and a second copy that I'll donate to someone who needs it.
Once I reach my goal, I'll approach organizations to figure out who to entrust with getting these books into the hands of low-income families and individuals. I hope to be able to work with a variety of organizations for the greatest reach.
Where'd this come from?
I created this cookbook as the capstone project for my master's degree in Food Studies at NYU. I wanted to make something that not only summed up the work I had done during my studies, but also had a useful life outside of academia.
It bothered me that so many ideas for fixing the food system leave out the poor: it seemed like they didn't have a voice in the food movement. I wanted to create a resource that would promote the joy of cooking and show just how delicious and inspiring a cheap meal can be if you cook it yourself.
Even though Food Stamps help millions of people across the United States every day, benefits were reduced in November despite rising food prices. It's more important than ever to make the most of what you have with savvy shopping techniques and skillful cooking. That's Good and Cheap.
Stretch goals!
If we reach $145,000:
TWENTY-SEVEN THOUSAND COPIES TOTAL available to non-profits at $4 apiece, plus shipping (in addition to the 6,300+ donated copies so far). And I will do five cartwheels.
If we reach $143,210 (GOOOOOOOOAL!):
I will make good and (relatively) cheap celebratory sangria and share the recipe with all of you!
If we reach $142,500 (STAGGERING!):
TWENTY-SIX THOUSAND COPIES TOTAL available to non-profits at $4 apiece, plus shipping (in addition to the 6,200+ donated copies so far). And I will watch Beverly Hills Cop III.
If we reach $140,000 (COWABUNGA!):
TWENTY-FIVE THOUSAND COPIES TOTAL available to non-profits at $4 apiece, plus shipping (in addition to the 6,100+ donated copies so far). And I will make smiley-face pancakes!
If we reach $135,000 (GREAT SCOTT!):
TWENTY-FOUR THOUSAND COPIES TOTAL available to non-profits at $4 apiece, plus shipping (in addition to the 5,900+ donated copies so far). And I will jump for joy!
If we reach $130,000 (WHAT THE WHAT???!):
TWENTY-THREE THOUSAND COPIES TOTAL available to non-profits at $4 apiece, plus shipping (in addition to the 5,700+ donated copies so far).
If we reach $125,000 (INCONCEIVABLE!):
TWENTY-TWO THOUSAND COPIES TOTAL available to non-profits at $4 apiece, plus shipping (in addition to the 5,500+ donated copies so far).
If we reach $120,000 (BANANAS!):
TWENTY-ONE THOUSAND COPIES TOTAL available to non-profits at $4 apiece, plus shipping (in addition to the 5,300+ donated copies so far).

FOUR THOUSAND COPIES TOTAL available to non-profits at $4 apiece, plus shipping (in addition to the donated copies so far).
If we reach $30,000 (DONE LIKE DINNER!):
Let's keep doing this! I'll print 1,000 more copies of Good and Cheap and offer them to worthwhile organizations at $4 per copy (plus cheap media-mail shipping). That's THREE THOUSAND COPIES TOTAL (in addition to the donated copies so far).
If we reach $25,000 (BAM! POW! BIFF!):
That last one happened so quickly, I haven't had time to think up a new stretch goal, so let's do the last one again! I'll print 1,000 more copies of Good and Cheap and offer them to worthwhile organizations at $4 per copy (plus cheap media-mail shipping).
If we reach $20,000 (AND WE DID!):
I'll print 1,000 more copies of Good and Cheap and offer them to worthwhile organizations at $4 per copy (plus cheap media-mail shipping). I've already spoken casually to a couple of organizations that think they can make that plan work. I'll let others know how to get in touch soon.
If we reach $15,000 (ACHIEVED!):
On behalf of all of you, I will donate another 250 copies of Good and Cheap to worthwhile organizations. That's on top of the copies that new backers will be donating on the way to $15,000!
I will open up 4 more "sponsor a recipe" rewards at $100 each (total 20). Don't worry — people who contribute to the project in the meantime will be able to upgrade to one of those open spots if they want to.

updates.update_userinfo: Join me for a Kickstarter Creator Hangout!
updates.update_content:
Hi, folks!
Long time no talk. I hope you're enjoying this fine Canada Day / Fourth of July weekend!
Kickstarter reached out to me to do one of their Creator Hangouts — a series of videos where a Kickstarter creator and the Kickstarter team chat and answer questions from anyone looking to know more about Kickstarting or the project in general. You can join the hangout and ask me questions, and we'll try to answer them right then and there.
So I'll be doing a How to Launch a Cookbook on Kickstarter hangout this coming Wednesday at 2pm ET. Just click the "Tickets Available" link on that Facebook page (don't worry, not a *real* ticket, just a special link) to sign in and ask a question, or just to watch live.

Hi, best friends!
The launch of the second edition of Good and Cheap has gone great — so well, in fact, that it's temporarily sold out on Amazon (and amazon.ca, too). But it'll be back in stock in a few days! Check out your local indie bookstore or Barnes and Noble if you need a copy ASAP (maybe as a gift!).
We sold out so quickly because of a few giant media hits — a great piece on NPR a few weeks ago, then (a nationally syndicated public radio show), followed by that was promoted on the front page of yahoo.com (you would how much traffic that gets you!) on the same day as , which is one of the most popular radio shows in Canada, and runs in many US cities as well.

updates.update_userinfo: 2nd edition of Good and Cheap is out today!
Good and Cheap wins IACP "Judge's Choice" Award
updates.update_content:
Hello lovely people!
I hope that you are delighting in springy activities wherever you are. Remember, peas and asparagus and strawberries will soon be everywhere!
To the point: Good and Cheap won a big award! 
The story

We wanted to give away Good and Cheap to people who needed it. And we did it in a bigger way than I ever thought possible.
I am vibrating with excitement to present you with a map. This map shows the more than 630 organizations who got all 9,000 donated copies and 24,000 discounted copies of Good and Cheap.
I can't embed the live map on Kickstarter — just a screenshot — but if you click through to my website, you can click the pins for each city to see all the organizations you've helped.

2nd Edition!
The new year is bringing a new phase for Good and Cheap. Last year was utterly, staggeringly incredible, but would you believe that this year might be even better?
I am officially sold out of the 1st edition of Good and Cheap. We gave away over 9,000 donated copies, sold 24,000 at cost to non profits and sold another 7,000 to you! Oh, and the free PDF has been downloaded over 500,000 times so far.

Good evening, terrific friends! Two quick, cool things:
Last chance to change your address
The printer in Wisconsin is mere days away from shipping the books to me, and then I'll get them into envelopes to mail out to you as quickly as possible. That means this is your last chance to change your address, in case you've moved or are about to move.

Good people of the Earth,
It took a couple more days than we wanted, but the book is done! It's at the printer now, and that means it's time for you to download a shiny new copy:
http://www.leannebrown.ca/good-and-cheap.pdf

campaign.story:
Instead of running to the tool box to grab a single-use tool, just grab the key chain in your pocket and solve your problems with the BOSS Multi-Tool.  This compact tool is just big enough to give you the leverage you need, but small enough to mix with your keys. 
The Boss gives you 9+ tools in a compact 1.25” x 3.25” frame.
The HEX Bolt Wrenches work on the following sizes: 7/32in, 5.5mm, 7mm, 3/8in, 9mm, 11mm, 5/16in, 14mm, 9/16in. 
The ruler is laser engraved in millimeters on one side and in inches on the other side. 
Add Boss to your keyring!
Easily open bottles.
Use the sawblade on your Boss tool for small projects.
Five hex wrenches adds unique functionality.
Use to cut small wires or fishing line.
Remove vinyl, rust or dirt with the scraper function.
Opening paint cans.
Screwdriver when you need it.
Open boxes with ease.
Use as a nail pry.
$10,000 STRETCH GOAL: Unlock the Bangle Multi-Tool
The BANGLE will come in titanium and has three additional features!
The BANGLE is unleashed!
Easy access on a key chain to the bottle opener and top scrapper.
The BANGLES additional wire stripper & cutter give an aggressive look.
The BANGLE has the same hex and ruler tools.
There is are now options to add both of these great tools to your collection.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have reduced a lot of the risk associated with this project by successfully producing multiple prototypes with a reputable manufacturer. We have working titanium and stainless steel prototypes of both the BOSS and BANGLE Multi-Tools. After project completion, the manufacturing time will be 18 to 22 days and the shipping will take one to two weeks. 

We are anticipating to have all tools shipped and delivered the last week of August or the first week of September 2014.

Thank you for your support in making these multi-tools a reality.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Hello Kickstarters, I know a lot of you have been curious about when you will receive your tools, please don't worry, we just heard back from our manufacturer and it's looking like we are a little more than half way complete in the production process. campaign.story:
Wonder how Coffee Blocks tastes? 
Coffee Blocks
  At Coffee Blocks we know that healthy fats are essential for building a strong foundation to start your day. We’ve created the easiest way to get these energy boosting fats into your diet.
Coffee Blocks are made with wholesome grass fed butter, organic coconut oil, free range egg yolks, and coffee. They’re individually packaged and frozen, just waiting for you to drop them into hot water.  
Coffee Blocks are naturally gluten free, they have zero carbs, and are full of the essential fats your body needs to function. These fats are like rocket fuel for your brain. 
Up until now, we've been making Coffee Blocks in a local kitchen. Now we have plans to start manufacturing them on a large scale.
We've got the whole supply chain lined up. We found the perfect manufacturing partner. Fulfillment is all setup so Coffee Blocks will arrive at your doorstep frozen in an insulated package.
Now we need the funding. We need you to back us and share our product.
Grass Fed Butter - The unsalted butter from grass fed cows is what gives Coffee Blocks it creamy texture & flavor. Butter slows the absorption of caffeine, giving you a longer energy boost and prevents the usual caffeine spike and crash. It helps with fat loss and is high in vitamins A, D, E, K2. It also has butyric fatty acids which is an anti-inflammatory.
Organic Coconut Oil - Coconut oil is a boost of instant energy & a fat burner. It supercharges brain function and fights viruses, bacteria, & fungi. Coconut oil helps build strong cell walls and regulates blood sugar and hormones. It gives Coffee Blocks a distinct flavor and even makes it seem sweet.
Organic Fair Trade Coffee - We found the perfect coffee to combine with the grass fed butter and coconut oil. Together, they make for the tastiest coffee drink we’ve ever had. Coffee has been shown to boost energy levels, brain function, and fat burning.
Free Range Egg Yolks - My mom always reminds me that “The eggs were let out of jail”, referencing the reversing of the myth that egg yolks and cholesterol are bad. Eggs add the essential texture to Coffee Blocks. They truly bring the whole thing together. Egg yolks contain choline and fat soluble vitamins A, D, E, K.
Organic Vanilla - Vanilla contains vanilloids (a real thing, I promise), which reduce inflammation and activates the same receptors as capsaicin (chili peppers). The vanilla in Coffee Blocks enhances the flavors of the other ingredients, giving Coffee Blocks our distinct flavor.
Our background is in reality television casting and development, but in our heart, we are inventors. One of our main areas of invention and “hacking” is in health and fitness. As former high-level athletes, we’ve got a passion for working out harder and eating healthier. 
One way we found to get more healthy fats in our diet, was Bulletproof Coffee. It’s a great idea, but it’s tough to make at work. So we hacked it and invented Coffee Blocks. A lot of the same benefits of Bulletproof Coffee, but way more convenient to make. 
$35,000 will cover all the expenses to manufacturer and bring Coffee Blocks directly to you. This includes: - Ingredients (only the best, grass fed butter, organic) - Manufacturing the Coffee Blocks (covers the facility and employees) - Packaging Equipment & Supplies - FREE Frozen Shipping (yup, free shipping!) - Long Term Shelf Life Testing (we know they are good frozen for a while, but how long?)
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Challenges: We’ve worked really hard this last year to work out all of the kinks in the system. We believe we’ve pushed through most of the big hurdles, but there might be more. We’ll keep you updated if we run into any. Here are some potential hurdles:

Ingredients: Because we use the best ingredients, they can sometimes be in limited supply. Grass Fed butter has been our biggest challenge to date. It turns out cows by near our manufacturer don’t eat grass during the winter, so we had to look elsewhere. Lucky for us, we’ve found a great source in Kerrygold Unsalted Butter. 

Packaging Sealer: The sealer we will be using needs to be shipped from overseas. There is potential it could get held up in customs. This could delay our manufacturing date. 
Supply Chain: We have planned to the best of our abilities to make sure everything is in place at the right time. But, if one thing falls behind schedule everything will. 

Manufacturing Delays: We’ve already done a test day with our manufacturer and are pleased. But, this is a brand new product that has never been made at this scale. There is potential for mishaps and inefficiencies in the process. 

Delays in Shipment: We have built a system that SHOULD scale with us no matter how successful we are. There are long distances for ingredients and final product to travel and that could cause unforeseen delays.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Don't forget them at work or on your porch; and make sure you store them in the freezer.

campaign.story:
Missed this project? You can still find this and other Calamityware plates at BuyCalamityware.com
________
I like drawings that make me laugh. When I inherited a traditional Blue Willow-pattern plate, I just had to redraw it and add a dinosaur. As I drew more plates and added more calamities—UFOs, Sasquatch, and volcanoes—folks urged me to produce real dinner plates. A Kickstarter project was born.
The first two Kickstarter projects went well (flying monkeys and giant robot), so here is the third project in what might turn out to be a long series. This design includes a hungry sea monster who appears to have escaped from the wild areas of an early Renaissance map. Imagine finding that bad boy behind your fish sticks!
Preparing prototype for pie test
The final production plates will feature a rich blue image on white porcelain. You can hang it on your wall or use it for dinner (food safe, microwave safe, dishwasher safe). Makes a flabbergasting gift.
If we get enough sponsors, the craftspeople at Bryan China Company (New Castle, PA, USA) will transfer the drawing to full-size dinner plates and fire them at 1500 degrees to permanently fuse the image to the porcelain. I expect to ship these plates before the end of August 2014. Perhaps sooner.
Series continues. I’m committed to producing at least six plate designs in this series. If sponsors remain enthusiastic, I’ll go to 12.
Here’s the current lineup.
Calamityware Plate 1: flying monkeys
Calamityware Plate 2: giant robot 
Calamityware Plate 3: voracious sea monster 
Calamityware Plate 4: UFO invasion?
Calamityware Plate 5: pirates in the neighborhood?
Calamityware Plate 6: to be announced. I’m considering a volcano, Sasquatch, mariachis, mimes, pterodactyls, a giant octopus, bats, alligators, and several other themes. But probably not all at once. Stay tuned. 
If you missed the previous Kickstarter projects and want to address a gap in your Calamityware plate collection, you’ll find a limited number of plates at BuyCalamityware.com
Will all the plates in this series match? No. The designs of the plate borders and central image will be very different. It’s also possible that the exact size of the plates and the shade of blue will shift slightly because the plates, transfers, and firing are going to be happening at different times, months apart. If you are a perfectionist about color matching, you should order a set of matching dishes with the same design on all. Even then, you might see a little variation. Welcome to the real world.
How can I get a set of six plates with different designs? If you want each of your guests to have a different calamity, the best way is to sponsor six or more separate, successive Kickstarter projects. I’m trying to space them 90 days apart. So it is going to take a while. But the wait will be worthwhile, right?
If you missed any of these projects, you need to get over to http://BuyCalamityware.com and catch up.
More back story. If you want more details about Calamityware plates, take a look at the previous Calamityware kickstarter projects and the weekly updates I shared. Search on the term “calamityware” or follow this link to the first project... https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/159974695/calamityware-dinner-plate-1
Want to see more of Don’s drawings? I post a new drawing of something almost every day on Flickr. Here https://flic.kr/ps/xUygP. You can see my Calamityware drawings in this Flickr set https://flic.kr/s/aHsjKazkKb
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Now that I have already done two of these Kickstarter projects, I’m beginning to understand some of the things that can go wrong. The world is full of calamities, so why should the world of Calamityware plates be any different? 

The technology of producing porcelain plates is sound. But every other part of the project is vulnerable to calamity, mishap, and fiasco. I’ve already figured out how to cope with delays, broken plates, flawed addresses, and slow-motion couriers. What next?

I give you my word, I will work tirelessly to get everyone their Calamityware 3 plates as soon as possible. It’ll probably be early August—in plenty of time for holiday gift giving if you live in North America. But some international orders will take a very long time to arrive. I don't know why, but they do.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
A version of our video with CLOSED CAPTIONS is available here.
Jul 1 - FINAL ADD-ON REWARDS IN UPDATE 26: For our final 24 hours, we've added limited edition DODOcases, Picnic Blankets, downloadable episodes of the original series and a live online event with Donald Glover & LeVar... from a boat!
   Jun 27 - MORE HUGE NEWS IN UPDATE 22: We've entered the Top 5 Kickstarter Projects... and the other four (Pebble, OUYA, Pono, Veronica Mars) have ALL offered special new rewards to help us get into more schools! Read more now!
Important updates, in case you missed them:
STRETCH GOALS #1: What we can do if we reach $5,000,000!
T-SHIRT DESIGNS: Three limited-edition designs to choose from! 
ADD-ON REWARDS: Instructions for adding more rewards!
ORIGINAL DVDs: Now available as reward add-ons!
Hi. LeVar Burton here. You may know me as Kunta Kinte, from ROOTS, or Geordi La Forge, from Star Trek: The Next Generation. 
You also may have grown up with me on Reading Rainbow. 
It was my mother who taught me that, by picking up a book, I could "go anywhere" and "be anything." Ever since Reading Rainbow began in 1983, I have dedicated myself to fostering a love of reading in children, just as my mother did for me. 
Over the past year, I have watched Kickstarter bring communities together to support artists and inventors. Again and again, I have been inspired by watching like-minded people team up to accomplish impossible dreams, and to change the world. 
Now, I am hoping you will join me on my mission: to bring Reading Rainbow back for every child, everywhere.
Together, we can change the lives of millions of children. But you don't have to take my word for it: just keep reading!
I believe that every child has a right, and a need, to be literate. We have a responsibility to prepare our children… and right now, the numbers show that we, as a society, are failing in that responsibility.
And here’s the problem:
And: numerous studies reveal that children who can't read at grade level by the 4th grade are 400% more likely to drop out of high school.
And: as of 2011, America was the only free-market country where the current generation was less well educated than the one before.
These problems won't solve themselves.  Real change will require us all to work together. We cannot afford to lose generations of children to illiteracy. And if we work together, we don't have to.
Through Reading Rainbow, we've been working to solve these problems for over three decades. Starting in 1983, Reading Rainbow successfully used television to turn generations of kids into lifelong readers... with great results.
Of course, when Reading Rainbow began in 1983, we were using television to bring books to kids, meeting them where they wanted to be. In 2014, TV is not that place anymore. Now, we’re trying to reach a new generation of digital natives.
That’s why, two years ago, I launched the Reading Rainbow App for tablets. Building on the basics of the television series, we put hundreds of quality books – and educational video field trips – right in a child’s hands.
The response has been encouraging:
But despite this progress, there are big challenges left to face.
First, not all families have access to tablets. Our goal is to cultivate a love of reading in all children, not just those that have tablets. To reach kids everywhere, we need to be everywhere: we need to be on the web, on mobile devices, on game consoles and on connected televisions. 
Second, a resounding number of teachers have told me that they want Reading Rainbow in their classrooms, where they know it can make a difference. We will provide it, along with the tools that teachers need, including teacher guides, leveling, and dashboards. And with your help, we'll provide it to thousands of disadvantaged classrooms for FREE.
Every Home. Reading Rainbow’s digital collection already contains hundreds of books and video field trips… but with your help, we’ll be able to make the Reading Rainbow library available on more of the devices modern kids use to consume content. Now that we've met our initial goal of $1,000,000, we will be able to launch a new version of Reading Rainbow on the single most-used digital platform: the web. And now that we've reached our stretch goal of$5,000,000, we'll also be able to bring the service to mobile phones, Android, game consoles like XBOX and PlayStation, and set-top boxes like AppleTV and ROKU.
Every Classroom. Together, we want to provide Reading Rainbow to as many classrooms as possible FOR FREE! Now that we've reached our stretch goal of $5,000,000, we'll be able to provide year-long subscriptions in over 7,500 classrooms – and every additional $100K we raise lets us help 500 more!
No matter how much we raise, we promise that every dollar you pledge will bring Reading Rainbow to more platforms, and provide it for free in more classrooms.
We can make sure that millions of kids learn to love reading, but we can’t do it without you. That's why I hope you’ll join me in making a difference!
I believe that spreading the love of reading is its own greatest reward. But if you're going to join our cause, we also have some wonderful prizes. But you don't have to take my word for it... Take a look!
Aside from the signed book, the rewards above will be available to anyone who pledges! 
But we also have several LIMITED EDITION rewards... so be sure to get them before we run out! (And if we DO run out, keep checking back -- we'll do our best to add more when we can!)
Or, if you prefer, you can also pledge for a reward package that will be gifted to the classroom or school of your choice!
And, if you're just interested in Star Trek related rewards, and don't want all of the Reading Rainbow goodies above, we've also got a few special reward levels created just for you:
This Kickstarter – and Reading Rainbow – couldn't happen alone, so I want you to meet the full team behind our Kickstarter.
Everytime I walk into the office, I am reminded that the Reading Rainbow team is made up of passionate, talented artists, producers, engineers, and so many more. Most of them grew up on the show, have families of their own now, and dedicate their working day to improving the lives of the next generation.  
It's an honor to be surrounded by my Reading Rainbow family every day, and we can't wait for you to join us. And if you do, you'll be hearing from several of us throughout the campaign, and after that, in our backer updates. Click on the picture below to learn more about us!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The real risks and challenges we face don't lie in completing this project, but in the problems that we'll face without it.

If we raise our minimum funding goal, we do not anticipate ANY significant challenges or risks in completing the project.

As with all Kickstarter projects, there is always a risk of delay in delivering some of the rewards, but we've been careful to give ourselves MORE time than we think we'll need – so we hope we'll have some, or all, of the rewards out SOONER than listed.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Dear Backers,
This has been such an INCREDIBLE year!
One year ago, we were getting ready to hit “GO!” on the Reading Rainbow Kickstarter campaign. The Reading Rainbow team huddled around computers, and watched closely as EVERY SINGLE ONE OF YOU pledged in support of our mission. Our dream has always been to instill a passion for reading and show children how they can experience the fun of learning through the world of literature.

updates.update_userinfo: Reading Rainbow Donates Skybrary School to 3,500 Classrooms at the National Title 1 Conference
updates.update_content:
Dear Backers, 
What a truly incredible whirlwind of a year it has been for us. We are so thankful and humbled for all of the new opportunities and doors that have opened for us thanks to Y-O-U contributing to our massive Kickstarter campaign! We have some very exciting February news to share and want you to be one of the FIRST to know! 
As part of bringing Reading Rainbow to “Every Child, Every Where”, we PARTNERED WITH YOUTUBE and their all-new kid-friendly video platform, to bring an exclusive Video Field Trip series to our children. Reading Rainbow’s series is designed to do for kids and technology today what the Classic Reading Rainbow series did for kids and reading 32 years ago: to make science and technology. In this brand new series Reading Rainbow plans to address technology ranging from electric toothbrushes to the Mars Rover, from kids and computers to space travel—and we’ll do it all in a way that makes technology exciting and easy for kids to understand!

project_data.project_name: Bring Reading Rainbow Back for Every Child, Everywhere!

campaign.story:
I like drawings that make me laugh. When I inherited a traditional blue willow-pattern plate that belonged to my mother’s grandparents, I just had to redraw it and add a dinosaur. As I drew more plates and added more calamities—UFOs, sea monsters, and volcanoes—folks urged me to produce real dinner plates. A Kickstarter project was born. 
That first project went well (flying monkeys), so here is the second Kickstarter project in what might turn out to be a long series. Based on exhaustive consumer research, I’ve determined that Calamityware Plate 2 should feature a giant robot lurking among the exotic trees and buildings of a traditional willow-pattern plate. Imagine that bad boy lurking behind your meatloaf or brussels sprouts. 
Drawing we will transfer to plates.
Production plates will feature a rich blue image on white porcelain. You can hang it on your wall or use it for dinner (food safe, microwave safe, dishwasher safe). Makes a great gift. 
If we get enough sponsors, the craftspeople at Bryan China Company (New Castle, PA, USA) will transfer the drawing to full-size dinner plates and fire them at 1500 degrees to permanently fuse the image to the porcelain. I plan to ship these plate by late May 2014.
Details from the first Calamityware plate which featured flying monkeys.
Series continues. I’m committed to continuing this series as long as there are enough Kickstarter sponsors to justify firing up the kiln for each design. Plate 3 will be a voracious sea monster. On Plate 4, a pirate ship threatens the neighborhood. And Plate 5 includes a UFO invasion. I haven’t yet decided what to draw for plate 6. But first, we need to float this project.
If you want more details about Calamityware plates, take a look at the first Calamityware kickstarter project and the weekly updates I shared. https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/159974695/calamityware-dinner-plate-1
Want to see more of Don’s drawings? I post a new drawing of something almost every day on Flickr. You can see my Calamityware drawings in this Flickr set http://flic.kr/s/aHsjKazkKb
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Calamities can confound any project. But there’s little risk here. I just completed a similar project (Calamityware Plate 1, flying monkeys) and we are using proven technology, some of it unchanged for a thousand years. But wait. That’s just the kind of attitude that develops before the poo hits the fan, isn’t it? I could lose my drawing, develop a mysterious amnesia, be abducted by aliens, or the kilns could explode. When you look at it through a calamity lens, you see that it will be a miracle if this project ever gets done. But I give you my word, I will work tirelessly to get everyone their Calamityware 2 plates as soon as possible. It’ll probably be late May—in plenty of time to be a wedding gift for any summer nuptials.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
